name: Sioux Dancer Earrings
description:
These beautiful handpainted earrings were made by Rosebud Sioux artist Miguel Stands and Looks Back. They feature a detailed portrait of a powwow dancer painted on rawhide circles. The backsides are also painted, with a simple yet elegant dragonfly design. They are sealed to protect against moisture or fading.

The green set is slightly smaller than the red set, and measures nearly 2" in diameter while the red set measures just over 2" in diameter. They are both ultra lightweight earrings. Whether they are a gift for yourself or for someone special in your life, these earrings come packaged in a pretty jewelry box with ribbon. This item ships from the US.

name: Nathalie Waldman & Max Early Tote Bag
description: This beautiful deer tanned cow hide leather tote was designed and created by Yellowknives Dene First Nations artist Nathalie Waldman in collaboration with Laguna Pueblo potter, Max Early. It features a one-of-a-kind painting by Early. The bag is also embellished with long flowing lace fringes. Each bag is constructed by hand by Waldman so each is unique and slightly different. The bag measures 15" x 10" and the strap is 24" long. This item ships from the US. Max Early was born into the Turkey Clan of his mother and Bear Clan of his father at Laguna Pueblo. He grew up with his grandparents. During his early teenage years, he painted some of his grandmother’s pottery. He refined his technique to a personal touch, while maintaining traditional Laguna design symbols and compositions. Waldman is a member of the Dene First Nation Dogrib Tribe located in the Northwest Territories, Canada.

name: Plains Indian Beaded Wallet
description: This is handsomely beaded wallet features a bold geographic design in red, black, light blue and periwinkle on a creamy white background. The vintage wallet has a beautiful and soft brown leather interior. It measures 4.5"x 3.25". Whether it is a gift for yourself or for someone special, this wallet comes packaged in a BBB jewelry box with ribbon. This item ships from the US.

name: Medicine Wheel Quilled Bolo Tie
description:
This stunning bolo tie was designed and created by Lonna Jackson (Spirit Lake Dakota / Turtle Mountain Chippewa). The artist plucks the quills, cleans them, then dyes them before beginning the process of wrapping them to create this vibrant bolo tie.

The center piece boasts 4 rows of quillwork around a central metal button, backed with creamy white leather, and measures 2.75" in diameter. The slide piece sits on a black braided leather cord, which ends in short 2" white buckskin fringe that has been attached to the cord with more beautiful wrapped quillwork. Whether it is a gift for yourself or for someone special, this bolo tie comes packaged in a BBB jewelry box with ribbon. This item ships from the US.

Porcupine quillwork is an art form that is unique to North America, and Native people of this continent used quills as an important decorative technique before the introduction of glass beads. Though beadwork blossomed as a significant artistic medium for Native people, several groups and individuals maintain the age-old traditional practice of quillwork.

name: Quilled Headbands
description:
These beautiful headbands were designed and created by Lonna Jackson (Spirit Lake Dakota / Turtle Mountain Chippewa). The artist plucks the quills, cleans them, then dyes them before beginning the process of wrapping them to create these vibrant headbands. Each headband features 3 rows of quillwork in different color patterns. They can be worn across the forehead, over the top of the head as a headband, or as a choker necklace. They can even be worn as a hatband. They are each backed with luxurious white buckskin and have buckskin lace ties.

The Sage Green option measures 1" x 13" with 9" white buckskin ties (31" total length). The medium Red option measures 1.25" x 15" with 9.5" buckskin ties (34" total length). The large Blue Rhinestone option measures 1.5" x 13.5" with 11" ties (35" total length). This item ships from the US.

name: Beaded and Quill Chain Earrings
description: These beautiful chandelier earrings were made by Inuit artist Caroline Blechert. They feature 24-Karat gold-plated Delica beads, Surgical Steel Earring Hooks, Sterling Silver Chains, and Porcupine Quills. The longer gold set measures 3.75'' long and 1'' wide. The shorter white set measures 3.2" x 1" and ends in Swarovski Crystals. This item ships from Canada. Blechert uses porcupine quills in such modern and striking ways that her collections are both memorable and enchanting. She is Inuvialuit, and was born and raised in Yellowknife - a community located in the Northwest Territories of Canada, and this influence of the far north environment is evident in her work.

name: Parfleche Cuff
description:
This Parfleche cuff was made by award-winning artist Jamie Okuma (Luiseño/Shoshone Bannock). A modernist version of the classical Native American parfleche containers of the 1800s, this cuff features a hand-cut design in brass over Italian leather to create a subdued version of the colorful original parfleche bags. This item ships from the US. 

Okuma began working with beads as a child creating her own dance regalia for powwows near her home, on the La Jolla Luiseño Reservation. Historical accuracy, exemplary workmanship, and keen attention to detail are the hallmarks of her work. At the age of 22, Okuma became the youngest artist in the history of Santa Fe Indian Market to win Best of Show, which would become the first of her five Best in Show awards: three from SWAIA and two from the Heard Museum Indian Fair and Market. She is now venturing into the exciting world of contemporary fashion. Price of shipping and handling included.

name: Winter Sun Earrings
description: These silver and maroon earrings were made by Michael Adams (Hopi/Tewa). The earrings measure approximately 1.5” in diameter. This item ships from the US. Born on the Hopi reservation and surrounded by culture and art, Adams was inspired to create his own style with jewelry. He looks to his parents for inspiration; his mother is a Hopi/Tewa potter and his father is a Katsina doll carver. Each earring is created using gourd or basswood. He hand-cuts, shapes, and then paints each earring using acrylics. A final coating of protective gloss seals the design and gives the earring a shine. He explained, "I love to incorporate color and Hopi symbolism into my designs all referencing nature as it occurs naturally."

name: Beaded Buffalo Bolo Tie
description:
This handsome Lakota-made bolo tie is fully beaded in gorgeous hues of tan, brown, white, and fire colors. The beaded buffalo skull design sits upon a white leather braided cord. The beaded piece measures 3.5" x 3". 

Bolo ties are widely associated with the American West, and they have been part of Native American silversmithing traditions since the mid-20th century; beaded bolo ties have been made for decades on the Northern Plains and worn by leaders and businessmen. The bolo tie is the official neckwear in Arizona, New Mexico and Texas. 

Expertly constructed, this is a great piece for a great guy. Whether it is a gift for yourself or for someone special, this tie comes packaged in a BBB jewelry box with ribbon. This item ships from the US.

name: Healing Horse Bolo Tie
description: This sterling silver bolo tie was made by Kathy Whitman-Elk Woman (Mandan / Hidatsa / Arikara). It is #2 in a series of 25 all hand-made (no casting). It measures 3.5" x 2.75". Kathy explains, "Nature and my culture go hand in hand, and they are my influences. I’m also inspired to be an active participant in the upkeep of Mother Earth by contributing to her healing through the art that I create." This item ships from the US.

Born on the Hopi reservation and surrounded by culture and art, Adams was inspired to create his own style with jewelry. He looks to his parents for inspiration; his mother is a Hopi/Tewa potter and his father is a Katsina doll carver. Each earring is created using gourd or basswood. He hand-cuts, shapes, and then paints each earring using acrylics. A final coating of protective gloss seals the design and gives the earring a shine. name: Cedar Bracelet with Abalone Button
description: This bracelet was made by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. It features a square abalone button on a handwoven red cedar bark bracelet. It measures 10" x 1.5". This item ships from Canada. O’Brien weaves baskets, hats and jewelry with red and yellow cedar bark using twining and plaiting forms of weaving. Cedar bark weaving has been part of the culture of the peoples of the Northwest Coast for thousands of years; it was and continues to be an integral part of the culture. The process is deeply spiritual: beginning with an offering of tobacco to give thanks to the tree for its offering, O’Brien then strips, soaks, and prepares the bark to be woven. It is a way to carry on the traditional ways of her ancestors, and share this medicine with the world. The pricing of her art is based on the amount of time spent harvesting the bark, preparation and weaving time, finish and type of weave.

name: Navajo Rug Earrings
description: HOLIDAY SALE: Take 25% off this item, regularly priced $150. While supplies last. These intricately-made earrings were designed by the sister and brother team TSOul. Drawing on their heritage and the colors of the Southwest, the Navajo duo creates cool beaded jewelry in various forms. These earrings feature a rug design made using size 11 seed beads in hematite, oxblood, black and turquoise blue. Hematite bugle beads add texture to one side. They hang on gunmetal earhooks, and are accented with chain fringe and hematite and jet roundelles. They measure 2.5" x .5". Travis handles the business side while Kendra is the artistic half. Kendra is inspired by nature, classic Navajo rug designs, as well as mathematics and science - her undergraduate degree was in engineering, so elements of calculus, organic chemistry and physics inspire her to create three-dimensional shapes for her beadwork and jewelry. This item ships from the US.

name: Four Direction Loksi Leather Wrap Bracelet
description: These cool leather wrap bracelets were designed by Chickasaw metalsmith Kristen Dorsey. They each feature the Loksi (turtle) shell in beautiful fine silver over sterling silver on super soft and luxurious hand cut leather in turquoise, black or ivory. This item ships from the US. Loksi (turtle) is a central aspect of the Stomp Dance. Shells are filled with pebbles and bound together on leather. Women then wear them on their legs as they dance, creating the rhythm of the music. The Stomp Dance is performed by various Native communities, including the Muscogee, Cherokee, Chickasaw, Choctaw, and others. Each wrap bracelet features the Kristen Dorsey Designs logo tag on one end and the other side can be trimmed to fit any size wrist. Add a touch of culture to your wardrobe with these subtle nods to Turtle Island. Durable and sexy.

name: Pathways: Earthen"wear" Red Set
description: These handmade porcelain clay earring and necklace sets were created by Courtney M. Leonard (Shinnecock Nation). The sets are a part of her "Pathways" design series. Each piece is unique, one-of-a-kind, and handmade. Designs may be replicated but will never be exactly the same, much like the paths we take in life. Leonard views jewelry as an extension of our bodies and our minds, and the patterns on the discs reflect magnified aspects of our stamped records of time. Each recalls history and our cultural landscape. The earrings and pendants measure approximately 1.5" in diameter. The earrings hang on sterling silver findings and the pendant hangs on an 18" cable necklace. Interested in ideas of jewelry as human architecture, Leonard is an artist and filmmaker whose work explores the evolution of language, image and culture through various media including video, audio, and tangible objects. She currently lives in Santa Fe, New Mexico and works as a professional artist, lecturer, and Adjunct Faculty at the Institute of American Indian Arts. This item ships from the US.

They were valued as an international trade item and commerce, deemed as sacred wealth. Dentalium shells from the shores of Vancouver island have been harvested and traded since 1-1000 BCE.

name: Spiritual Fortitude Earrings
description: These earrings were made by Kathy Whitman-Elk Woman (Mandan / Hidatsa / Arikara). They are made from recycled aluminum cans and Swarovski Crystals (colors may vary depending on can). They measure 2" round and hang on sterling silver French hooks (not pictured). This item ships from the US. Kathy explains, "Nature and my culture go hand in hand, and they are my influences. I’m also inspired to be an active participant in the upkeep of Mother Earth by contributing to her healing through the art that I create. By using materials, that are byproducts of consumer goods for my medium, I could accomplish this idea and this purpose. I chose aluminum cans and plastic bottles because they seem to be two of the most abundant land pollutants in the world. For every can and plastic bottle that becomes a part my art, that much less is put into the environment. Through this body of work, my hope is to change the perspective of the general public, to raise the consciousness about our impact on the environment and make positive changes, no matter how minute they may seem, and to broaden the minds to new possibilities of using byproduct materials to create fine art, therefore saving the environment and impacting all of life."

name: Druzy Beaded Charm Bracelet
description:
This bracelet was designed by the sister and brother team TSOul. Drawing on their heritage and the colors of the Southwest, the Navajo duo creates cool beaded jewelry in various forms. The bracelet features chunky chains and beaded charms to compliment the gorgeous druzy stone. The bracelet is adjustable from 7 to 8 inches on vintage brass chains. This item ships from the US.

Kendra brings the artistic component while Travis handles the business side. Kendra is inspired by nature, classic Navajo rug designs, as well as mathematics and science - her college degree was in engineering, so elements of calculus, organic chemistry and physics inspire her to create three-dimensional shapes for her beadwork and jewelry.

name: Gold Sunflower Design Earrings
description: These earrings were made by Michael Adams (Hopi/Tewa). The earrings measure approximately 1.5” in diameter. This item ships from the US. Born on the Hopi reservation and surrounded by culture and art, Adams was inspired to create his own style with jewelry. He looks to his parents for inspiration; his mother is a Hopi/Tewa potter and his father is a Katsina doll carver. Each earring is created using gourd or basswood. He hand-cuts, shapes, and then paints each earring using acrylics. A final coating of protective gloss seals the design and gives the earring a shine. He explained, "I love to incorporate color and Hopi symbolism into my designs all referencing nature as it occurs naturally."

name: Cascading Chevron Earrings
description: HOLIDAY SALE: Take 25% off this item, regularly priced $145. While supplies last. These intricately-made earrings were designed by the sister and brother team TSOul. Drawing on their heritage and the colors of the Southwest, the Navajo duo creates cool beaded jewelry in various forms. They feature three cascading chevrons beaded in a geometric/rug inspired pattern with size 15 seed beads in black, orange, turquoise blue and other colors. Gunmetal hardware and earhook. They measure .75" x 2". This item ships from the US. Travis handles the business side while Kendra is the artistic half. Kendra is inspired by nature, classic Navajo rug designs, as well as mathematics and science - her undergraduate degree was in engineering, so elements of calculus, organic chemistry and physics inspire her to create three-dimensional shapes for her beadwork and jewelry.

name: White Crossbody Bag
description:
This crossbody bag was made by award-winning artist Jamie Okuma (Luiseño/Shoshone Bannock). It is made with textured Italian leather, and edged with cut beads.  Embellished with white spikes, and lined with ebony Italian leather. This item ships from the US. Price of shipping and handling included.

Okuma began working with beads as a child creating her own dance regalia for powwows near her home, on the La Jolla Luiseño Reservation. Historical accuracy, exemplary workmanship, and keen attention to detail are the hallmarks of her work. At the age of 22, Okuma became the youngest artist in the history of Santa Fe Indian Market to win Best of Show, which would become the first of her five Best in Show awards: three from SWAIA and two from the Heard Museum Indian Fair and Market. She is now venturing into the exciting world of contemporary fashion.

name: Loksi (Turtle) Earrings
description: These Loksi (turtle) earrings were made by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. Loksi (turtle) is a central aspect of the Stomp Dance. Shells are filled with pebbles and bound together on leather. Women then wear them on their legs as they dance, creating the rhythm of the music. These earrings represent the backs of the important turtle and are made using sterling silver with either rainbow moonstone or black freshwater pearl. The earrings hang 1.5" long. This item ships from the US. Dorsey seeks to bring the power and beauty of ancient Southeast Native American symbols to the present through her exquisite jewelry collections. Always an eye on the past, Dorsey brings the meanings and stories forward with each of her creations. Her work reflects Chickasaw cultural values, history, and jewelry traditions, as well as the natural beauty of her home in southern California. Click here to order the Loksi (Turtle) Necklace.

name: Spike Mini Clutch
description:
This mini clutch was made by award-winning artist Jamie Okuma (Luiseño/Shoshone Bannock).  Made with gorgeously golden brain-tanned buckskin, it is edged with antique cut beads and embellished with silver spikes, zipper closure, and lined with ebony Italian leather.

Okuma began working with beads as a child creating her own dance regalia for powwows near her home, on the La Jolla Luiseño Reservation. Historical accuracy, exemplary workmanship, and keen attention to detail are the hallmarks of her work. At the age of 22, Okuma became the youngest artist in the history of Santa Fe Indian Market to win Best of Show, which would become the first of her five Best in Show awards: three from SWAIA and two from the Heard Museum Indian Fair and Market. She is now venturing into the exciting world of contemporary fashion. Price of shipping and handling included.

name: Spike Medium Clutch
description:
This clutch was made by award-winning artist Jamie Okuma (Luiseño/Shoshone Bannock). It is made with embossed Italian leather and edged with antique beads and gold spike embellishments.  Zipper closure and lined with ebony Italian leather.

Okuma began working with beads as a child creating her own dance regalia for powwows near her home, on the La Jolla Luiseño Reservation. Historical accuracy, exemplary workmanship, and keen attention to detail are the hallmarks of her work. At the age of 22, Okuma became the youngest artist in the history of Santa Fe Indian Market to win Best of Show, which would become the first of her five Best in Show awards: three from SWAIA and two from the Heard Museum Indian Fair and Market. She is now venturing into the exciting world of contemporary fashion. Price of shipping and handling included.

name: Mother of Pearl Cedar Bark Earrings
description: These earrings were made by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. They feature mother of pearl buttons on red cedar bark rectangular shaped earrings. They measure 1.5" x 2". This item ships from Canada. O’Brien weaves baskets, hats and jewelry with red and yellow cedar bark using twining and plaiting forms of weaving. Cedar bark weaving has been part of the culture of the peoples of the Northwest Coast for thousands of years; it was and continues to be an integral part of the culture. The process is deeply spiritual: beginning with an offering of tobacco to give thanks to the tree for its offering, O’Brien then strips, soaks, and prepares the bark to be woven. It is a way to carry on the traditional ways of her ancestors, and share this medicine with the world. The pricing of her art is based on the amount of time spent harvesting the bark, preparation and weaving time, finish and type of weave.

name: Earth Earrings
description:
Earth is one of four designs in the Fall/Winter 2013 "ELEMENTS" by MaRia A. Bird (Navajo/Hopi/Santa Clara Pueblo) for Mea B'fly Designs. Mea B'fly was inspired to create "Earth" based on her love for flowers and the innocence that Mother Earth is loved with. The focal image this time within "Earth" is Singing Beauty- Crow- in black and white among sepia toned floral design work by Mea B'fly. Neutral tones give balance to the stark black and white which represents the way day and night shine upon earth giving Light to showcase her Beauty.  Like most Mea B'fly pieces, "Earth" is not only a piece of jewelry to adorn yourself but a conversation piece of identity, individuality, and ideology. This item ships from the US. 

Each graphic print is made by Bird, starting with a focal background image that she elaborates with other design elements. The graphic prints are then adhered to a balsa wood piece and topped off with surgical steel earring hooks and jump rings. They are bright with vivid color patterns, lightweight for a comfortable wear, and glossy with a slick overcoat to protect the design. Mea B'Fly earrings are a great fusion of the powerful past with the energy of today.

artists.name: MaRia Bird (Navajo / Hopi / Santa Clara Pueblo)

name: Feminine Wayfarer Sunglasses
description: These beaded sunglasses were made by Cree/Metis artist Candace Halcro. They feature feminine wayfarer style frames that have been hand-beaded using multicolored seed beads in gold, coral, and fire colors. This item ships from Canada. Each pair is one of a kind. Superior quality in both the frames and the beads, the patterns are straight and vibrant with colorful combinations. Held to the frames by contact cement, the glass beads will not come loose with regular wear. Custom orders are available upon request at an increased price. One size.

name: Freeing Yourself
description: This sterling silver flower pendant was made by Kathy Whitman-Elk Woman (Mandan / Hidatsa / Arikara). It is a one-of-a-kind piece and measures 1.75" . I’m also inspired to be an active participant in the upkeep of Mother Earth by contributing to her healing through the art that I create." This item ships from the US.

The wrap measures 57" X 11.5" and is adjustable to fit many body sizes, and can be worn many different ways, for all occasions. This item ships from the US. Kathy explains, "Nature and my culture go hand in hand, and they are my influences. I’m also inspired to be an active participant in the upkeep of Mother Earth by contributing to her healing through the art that I create."

name: Layered Arrowhead Necklace - Black Metal
description: HOLIDAY SALE: Take 30% off this item, regularly priced $300. While supplies last. This cool necklace was designed by the sister and brother team TSOul. Drawing on their heritage and the colors of the Southwest, the Navajo duo creates cool beaded jewelry in various forms. This beaded statement necklace features three individually beaded arrowheads made with size 11 seed beads in Metallic silver, Metallic Gold & Hematite. The reverse side features matte black seed beads. The arrowheads hang on a gunmetal chain & hardware to give the necklace a layered look. Each arrowhead measures .75" x 2". The length of the chain adjusts from 20"-24". This item ships from the US. Kendra brings the artistic component while Travis handles the business side. Kendra is inspired by nature, classic Navajo rug designs, as well as mathematics and science - her college degree was in engineering, so elements of calculus, organic chemistry and physics inspire her to create three-dimensional shapes for her beadwork and jewelry.

name: Beaded Tribal Necklace
description: These beaded necklaces were made by Cree/Metis artist Candace Halcro. They feature geometric patterns beaded in various color combinations on a silver plated chain with silver feathers that hang from the end. Perfect for everyday, delicate enough to add a little tribal touch to any outfit or layer it up for a boho look. It hangs just below the breast line, measuring 19 inches (to the tip of the feather). This item ships from Canada.

name: Meaningful Life Earrings
description: These earrings were made by Kathy Whitman-Elk Woman (Mandan / Hidatsa / Arikara). They are made from recycled aluminum cans and Swarovski Crystals (colors may vary depending on can). They measure 2" round and hang on sterling silver French hooks (not pictured). This item ships from the US. Kathy explains, "Nature and my culture go hand in hand, and they are my influences. I’m also inspired to be an active participant in the upkeep of Mother Earth by contributing to her healing through the art that I create. By using materials, that are byproducts of consumer goods for my medium, I could accomplish this idea and this purpose. I chose aluminum cans and plastic bottles because they seem to be two of the most abundant land pollutants in the world. For every can and plastic bottle that becomes a part my art, that much less is put into the environment. Through this body of work, my hope is to change the perspective of the general public, to raise the consciousness about our impact on the environment and make positive changes, no matter how minute they may seem, and to broaden the minds to new possibilities of using byproduct materials to create fine art, therefore saving the environment and impacting all of life."

name: Journey in Spirit Scarf
description: This scarf was designed by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. It features a killerwhale design in baby blue, soft pink, and navy blue. The scarf measures 27" x 70" and is made with a very soft sustainable material, bamboo. This item ships from Canada. Nalaga is a carver, weaver, painter, designer and jeweler. She started her company, Nalaga Designs in 2013 as a way to share the cultural knowledge and elegance of cedar bark weaving with the world. Cedar bark weaving has been her connection to the rich legacy of the Haida and Kwakwakw’wakw, and has also been a doorway for her to pursue other artforms. Nalaga Designs offers a unique array of cedar bark weavings, two dimensional designs, limited edition prints, trade bead jewelry, clothing and accessories.

name: Air Earrings
description:
Air is one of four designs in the "ELEMENTS" Collection by MaRia A. Bird (Navajo/Hopi/Santa Clara Pueblo) for Mea B'fly Designs. Mrs. Bird created "Air" inspired by the celestial translation of the power that guides us from above. Plenty Holes- Sioux- is the focal image set upon stars and galaxies which makes a bold, powerful statement of tradition and trend. Like most Mea B'fly pieces, Air is not only a piece of jewelry to adorn yourself but a conversation piece of identity, individuality, and ideology. This item ships from the US. 

Each graphic print is made by Bird, starting with a focal background image that she elaborates with other design elements. The graphic prints are then adhered to a balsa wood piece and topped off with surgical steel earring hooks and jump rings. They are bright with vivid color patterns, lightweight for a comfortable wear, and glossy with a slick overcoat to protect the design. Mea B'Fly earrings are a great fusion of the powerful past with the energy of today.

Her work has been greatly influenced by her families connection to the Longhouse, where traditional ways of life, customs and culture have never been broken. This item ships from Canada.

name: Constellation Ring
description: This ring was designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. Black conflict-free diamonds are set to look like a constellation of stars in the night sky. Ancestors of the Chickasaw nation were influenced by the movement of the stars and planets in all facets of life. The ring is also in the shape of a boat stone. Boat stones were used as a spear weight or for ceremonial purposes. Pair with the Sun Disk Ring for added flair. This item is part of Kristen's new Shokmalli' Collection. The ring is made with sterling silver and black conflict free diamond. The ring measures approximately 1.21” x 1” x .28” and is available in sizes 6, 7, and 8. Custom Sizes are also available. (Made to order, please allow for an additional 3-5 business days for production). Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Loksi Leather Wrap Bracelet
description:
HOLIDAY SALE: Take $10 off this item, regularly priced $40. While supplies last. This item was selected by Presence 4.0 style blogger and fashionista Chelsea Chee as an item to feature in our new P4xBBB collaboration project. Click here to read more and to see how Chelsea styles this cool bracelet with the Sea Monster Tunic and her moccasins.

These cool leather wrap bracelets were designed by Chickasaw metalsmith Kristen Dorsey. They each feature the Loksi (turtle) shell in beautiful sterling silver or rose gold plate over bronze on super soft and luxurious hand cut leather in turquoise, black, or gorgeous violet. Loksi (turtle) is a central aspect of the Stomp Dance. Shells are filled with pebbles and bound together on leather. Women then wear them on their legs as they dance, creating the rhythm of the music. The Stomp Dance is performed by various Native communities, including the Muscogee, Cherokee, Chickasaw, Choctaw, and others. Each wrap bracelet features the Kristen Dorsey Designs logo tag on one end and the other side can be trimmed to fit any size wrist. Add a touch of culture to your wardrobe with these subtle nods to Turtle Island. Durable and sexy. This item ships from the US.

name: Parfleche Earrings: Anu Kite Wyan
description:
These earrings were made by Sun Rose Iron Shell (Sicangu/Oglala Lakota) for her company, Warrior Status. They are inspired by traditional Northern Plains parfleche and are handpainted using acrylic paint on elk rawhide. 

This series honors "Anu Kite Wyan" Double Woman (AK Wyan), the spirit of art. To the Lakota, AK Wyan is the supernatural icon of Quillwork and rawhide painters. She is represented by the triangles that fold together to become a double helix. Adorned with Turquoise stone beads and Swavorski Crystals, these earrings bring contemporary chic to the traditional regal. Double-sided and ultra lightweight, they measure 5" X 2.5".

These earrings begin by soaking the hide till it becomes pliable and easier to cut. Once the shape of the earring is cut, it is flattened up to four days until the hide fully dries. The earring shapes are painted by hand and holes are drilled to add the finishing touches. This is a process that sometimes takes more than a week.

name: Cavalry Tee
description: This tee was designed by Navajo artist Dustin Martin for his company SOLO (Sovereign Original Land Owners). S.O.L.O.’s signature logo, the feathered cavalier and his horse symbolize the adaptability and tenacity that have helped Indigenous populations endure for centuries. American Indians might not be remembered today had they not taken the white man's beast and made it their own. Today they ride on; ponies beneath them, arrows aimed at their dreams. "In a market flooded with uninformed and poorly imitated 'Native' design, S.O.L.O. aims to create a product with a history. Through consultation and collaboration with the original owners of Indigenous design, S.O.L.O. works to bolster the voice of contemporary Native America and revolutionize industry conceptions of ownership, originality and authenticity. In appreciation for their artistic wisdom and guidance, S.O.L.O. pledges 15% of each sale to the communities that inspire our work. By giving back, we hope to strengthen Native-driven organizations that take pride in tradition and further promote cultural sovereignty." Details: Black print on Natural White tee. 100% combed cotton. Jersey knit. Tear-Away Tag. Printed in the USA. Unisex Athletic Fit. *Limited edition colorway for the Beyond Buckskin Boutique. This item ships from the US.

name: Southwest Studs (More Options)
description:
Add a dash of culture to your everyday outfit with these small post earrings. Perfect for casual days or dressy evenings. The chic vintage Zuni Petit Point Turquoise Studs are made with sterling silver and turquoise. The earrings measure .75" x .5" wide. The adorable Zuni Turtle Earrings feature handcarved studs made from various stones. The studs measure approximately .5" x .5". The tiny vintage Coral Flower Studs and the Turquoise Star Studs both measure about .25” in diameter. The Navajo-made iridescent purple pink flower earrings feature a beautiful opal stone set into a sterling silver bezel. The Zuni spiny oyster shell hearts are a creamy orange hue. These also measure about .25" in diameter.

Whether these are a gift for yourself or for someone special in your life, the earrings come packaged in a BBB jewelry box with ribbon. This item ships from the US.

name: Banner Stone Statement Earrings
description: These earrings were designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. The banner stone is a ceremonial object whose functional use was related to spear throwing. They were crafted by skilled stone carvers who perfected the symmetrical shapes to a high polish out of colorful and patterned stones. The shape of the shell inlay in these earrings is inspired by banner stones, which are perfectly symmetrical and balanced. The Banner Stone chandelier earrings feature Chalcedony drops to represent the sky accented with pale blue resin inlay. This item is part of Kristen's new Shokmalli' Collection. The earrings are made with rose gold plated bronze, shell laminate (Shell laminate is created from recycled natural shell pieces, a by-product of the fishing industry), resin, and Chalcedony briolette drop. They measure 4.41” x 1.31”. Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Moundville Ring
description: This ring was designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. The Chickasaw people are descendants of the metropolis of Moundville, located in today’s state of Alabama. Moundville was a major city fueled by trade and commerce, which thrived between 1,000AD to after 1500AD. Moundville is named after the great man-made earthen mounds, which still stand today. The Moundville ring is in the shape of a classic mound structure and is carved with sky serpent scales as a celebration of the continuance of our southeastern tribal legacy. This item is part of Kristen's new Shokmalli' Collection. The ring is made with rose gold over bronze or black rhodium over bronze set with resin. The ring measures approximately 1” x 1” x .54” and is available in sizes 6, 7, and 8. Custom Sizes are also available. (Made to order, please allow for an additional 3-5 business days for production). Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Feather Glove and Scarf Set
description: This glove and scarf set was designed by Tammy Beauvais (Mohawk Nation) and features applique eagle feathers on fleece and microsuede. Beauvais opened her first fashion design company, Tammy Beauvais Designs, in Kahnawake, Quebec in January 1999. Her work has been greatly influenced by her families connection to the Longhouse, where traditional ways of life, customs and culture have never been broken. This item ships from Canada.

name: Spiral Earrings
description: These spiral earrings were designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. Designed to pair with the Spiral Gorget, these earrings feature rose gold swirls inlayed with pale blue and yellow resin which frames a shell center panel. Graduated black triangles add visual energy to the design and reference a traditional feather pattern. The wind spiral is an ancient Chickasaw design found incised into pottery and remains an important motif in contemporary Chickasaw arts. This item is part of Kristen's new Shokmalli' Collection. The earrings are made with rose gold plated bronze, resin, and shell laminate (Shell laminate is created from recycled natural shell pieces, a by-product of the fishing industry). They measure 2” x 1 5/15.” Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Sun Disk Ring
description: This ring was designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. The hand carved ring is detailed with an intricate sunburst pattern inspired by an ancient southeastern carved shell gorget. The sunburst pattern was also used in other southeastern carved shell pieces to depict the feathered wings of southeastern sky deities. The sunburst ring is designed to layer with other sunburst rings and or the Constellation Ring, or it may be worn as a stand alone piece. The ring is set with conflict free black diamonds on one side. This item is part of Kristen's new Shokmalli' Collection. The ring is made with sterling silver and black conflict free diamond. The ring measures approximately 1.9” x .97” x .25” and is available in sizes 6, 7, and 8. Custom Sizes are also available. (Made to order, please allow for an additional 3-5 business days for production). Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Spiral Gorget
description: This gorget necklace was designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. Crescent shaped chest plates are an element of traditional Chickasaw regalia and are still worn today as a sign of leadership and cultural identity. In this gorget, enlarged wind spirals frame the shell center panel. The swirling rose gold spirals are inlaid with resin in pale yellow to represent sunlight, pale blue to represent the sky, and pearly white to reference the shell. Three strands of black square braided cord are finished with end caps attached to a 6 inch chain extender which is finished with a large KDD tag. This item is part of Kristen's new Shokmalli' Collection. The necklace is made with Rose gold plated bronze, resin, shell laminate, and environmentally friendly alternative to mother of pearl. (Shell laminate is created from recycled natural shell pieces, a by-product of the fishing industry), and braided leather chord (crafted in the USA with lead free dye). The metal piece measures 5 ¼ “ x 2 ½”, and the leather measures approximately 6” in length on either side with a 6” chain extender finished by a KDD logo tag. Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Sky Serpent Cuff
description: This Sky Serpent Cuff was designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. The original design of this statement cuff was fabricated using ancient relief sculpture techniques pioneered by ancestors of the Southeastern Native American tribes. A cloud-like formation of individually textured scales elegantly wraps around the wrist. The sky serpent is an important Southeastern being of the upperworld and can be found carved into ancient shell jewelry. Lightweight and wearable this cuff will infuse your look with history, culture, and edgy style day or night. This cuff features rose gold plate over bronze or black rhodium plate over bronze, and measures 2.3" width x 2.1" height. It is adjustable to fit most wrists. Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Copper Shield Cedar Earrings
description: These earrings were made by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. They feature tiny copper shields hanging in front of hand woven red cedar bark. They measure 1.5" x 2". This item ships from Canada. O’Brien weaves baskets, hats and jewelry with red and yellow cedar bark using twining and plaiting forms of weaving. Cedar bark weaving has been part of the culture of the peoples of the Northwest Coast for thousands of years; it was and continues to be an integral part of the culture. The process is deeply spiritual: beginning with an offering of tobacco to give thanks to the tree for its offering, O’Brien then strips, soaks, and prepares the bark to be woven. It is a way to carry on the traditional ways of her ancestors, and share this medicine with the world. The pricing of her art is based on the amount of time spent harvesting the bark, preparation and weaving time, finish and type of weave.

name: Banner Stone Pendant
description: These earrings were designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. The banner stone is a ceremonial object whose functional use was related to spear throwing. They were crafted by skilled stone carvers who perfected the symmetrical shapes to a high polish out of colorful and patterned stones. The shape of the shell inlay in these earrings is inspired by banner stones, which are perfectly symmetrical and balanced representing the duality of the sky world and the underwater world. The Banner Stone pendant features a Chalcedony drop to represent the sky. This item is part of Kristen's new Shokmalli' Collection. The pendant is made with rose gold plated bronze, shell laminate (Shell laminate is created from recycled natural shell pieces, a by-product of the fishing industry), and Chalcedony briolette drop. The pendant measures 2.4” long x 1.1” with a 17” chain with a 3” chain extender. Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Sleeping Dimes and Beauty Necklace
description: This necklace was designed and handmade by Navajo artist JT Willie. The turquoise is a lovely high grade Sleeping Beauty Turquoise stone which has been cut individually into sphere shapes. It is basically the best turquoise you can get in the marketing of Sleeping Beauty stones. The other beads are handmade sterling silver beads and 1930/1940 liberty dime beads. They are combined throughout the necklace. It is finished with an artist tag at the clasp. Measures an approximate 19 inches. Originally from Twin Lakes, New Mexico, Willie started beading as a teenager, learning techniques from his family, beaders, steamstress, and silversmiths. At the age of 16, he learned the style of beadwork from the Kiowa and Comanche Tribes of Oklahoma. He researches different styles of beadwork and incorporates them into his own unique style. This item ships from the US.

name: Banner Stone Chain Earrings
description: These earrings were designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. The banner stone is a ceremonial object whose functional use was related to spear throwing. They were crafted by skilled stone carvers who perfected the symmetrical shapes to a high polish out of colorful and patterned stones. The shape of the shell inlay in these earrings is inspired by banner stones, which are perfectly symmetrical and balanced, representing the duality of the sky world and the underwater world. Each earring is adorned with three chains to represent the three worlds; the sky world, the earth, and the underwater world. This item is part of Kristen's new Shokmalli' Collection. The earrings are made with rose gold plated bronze, and shell laminate (Shell laminate is created from recycled natural shell pieces, a by-product of the fishing industry). They measure 2.28” x 1.12”. Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Quartz Talon Earrings
description: These earrings were designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. Hand carved scales reference the sky serpent being of southeastern cosmology. The earrings are set with blue sapphire to symbolize the sky. The dagger shaped rutilated quartz adds a subtle edge to the design. This item is part of Kristen's new Shokmalli' Collection. The earrings are made with rose gold plated silver, blue sapphire, ruitilated quartz. They measure 2” x ½”. Note: stone size, color, and cut will vary slightly. Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Four Direction Loksi Collar Necklace
description: This necklace was designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. Central to Chickasaw culture, four loksi shells are arranged in the four directions. Loksi (turtle) is a central aspect of the Stomp Dance. Shells are filled with pebbles and bound together on leather. Women then wear them on their legs as they dance, creating the rhythm of the music. This statement necklace featured the loksi design in a breath taking arrangement accented by faceted black onyx. The substantial leather braid compliments the textures of the metal and echoes the black of the stones. This item is part of Kristen's new Shokmalli' Collection. The necklace is made with Rose gold plated bronze, Black braided leather (lead free dye), and Black onyx. The necklace measures about 7” wide and 3.5” long (from chord), and the stones measure 1.5” long. The necklace hangs 16” at shortest link and 22” at longest link. Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Brown Eagle Feather Bag and Coin Purse
description: This chic purse was designed by Tammy Beauvais (Mohawk Nation) and features applique eagle feathers and a coin purse inside. The bag measures 12.5” x 7.5” x 12”. Beauvais opened her first fashion design company, Tammy Beauvais Designs, in Kahnawake, Quebec in January 1999. Her work has been greatly influenced by her families connection to the Longhouse, where traditional ways of life, customs and culture have never been broken. This item ships from Canada.

name: Straight Quill Earrings
description:
These beautiful earrings were skillfully created by Lonna Jackson (Spirit Lake Dakota / Turtle Mountain Chippewa). The artist plucks the quills, cleans them, then dyes them before beginning the process of wrapping them to create the earrings. Each earring is made with precise rows, tight wraps, and a neat back for superior quality.

Porcupine quillwork is an art form that is unique to North America, and Native people of this continent used quills as an important decorative technique before the introduction of glass beads. Though beadwork blossomed as a significant artistic medium for Native people, several groups and individuals maintain the age-old traditional practice of quillwork.

These super lightweight earrings measure 3.5" long. Whether it's a gift for yourself or for someone special in your life, these earrings come packaged in a jewelry box with ribbon. This item ships from the US.

artists.name: Lonna Jackson (Spirit Lake Dakota / Turtle Mountain Chippewa)

name: Vivid Feathers Beaded Earrings
description:
These beautiful earrings come from the creative hands of MaRia A. Bird (Navajo/Hopi/Santa Clara Pueblo), the owner of Mea B'fly Designs, and feature vividly, bright size 12 translucent beads in Sun colors cradled by cut beads in Eagle feather colors. These Mea B'fly tulips are easily a top color combination in this design. Each color combination is never recreated for purchase making each Mea B'fly Tulip pair one of a kind. Mea B'fly beadwork is made to last Traditions and Time, not Trends. They measure 4 1/2" x 2." This item ships from the US. 

Bird comes from a small community on the western edge of the Navajo Nation and northern edge of the Hopi reservation. Bird stated, "My creation and traditional upbringing began on the geographical border of my identity - Dine' and Hopi - ironically but luckily. Twenty something years later here I am a proud Native American woman, strong, married, instictivly motherly, humbly spoken, humanly hearted, creatively skilled, and infinitely linked to the roots of Mother Earth."

artists.name: MaRia Bird (Navajo / Hopi / Santa Clara Pueblo)

name: Rectangular Cedar Earrings
description: These earrings were made by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. They feature hand woven red cedar bark on copper hooks and measure 1.5" x 2.5". This item ships from Canada. O’Brien weaves baskets, hats and jewelry with red and yellow cedar bark using twining and plaiting forms of weaving. Cedar bark weaving has been part of the culture of the peoples of the Northwest Coast for thousands of years; it was and continues to be an integral part of the culture. The process is deeply spiritual: beginning with an offering of tobacco to give thanks to the tree for its offering, O’Brien then strips, soaks, and prepares the bark to be woven. It is a way to carry on the traditional ways of her ancestors, and share this medicine with the world. The pricing of her art is based on the amount of time spent harvesting the bark, preparation and weaving time, finish and type of weave.

name: Beaded Gold Wayfarers
description: These ultra-cool beaded sunglasses were made by Cree/Metis artist Candace Halcro. They feature Wayfarer style frames that have been hand-beaded using multicolored seed beads in bright and vibrant hues. Each pair is one of a kind. Superior quality in both the frames and the beads, the patterns are straight and vibrant with colorful combinations. Held to the frames by contact cement, the glass beads will not come loose with regular wear. Custom orders are available upon request at an increased price. One size / Unisex. This item ships from Canada.

name: Yé’ii Tee
description: Often fitted with rectangular heads and antenna-like head-plumes, yé’ii are the symbolic representations of Navajo deities. First seen by westerners in the ceremonial sand paintings of hataalís, or medicine men, these figures stand for the elements that foster life on earth (such as wind and rain). Though much more ornate than traditional yé’ii, this rendition’s naturalistic elements and complex symmetry work together to give the viewer a sense of balance- the foremost virtue in Navajo religion and philosophy. This shirt features a chalk colored design on a midnight tee designed by Navajo artist Dustin Martin for his company SOLO (Sovereign Original Land Owners). "In a market flooded with uninformed and poorly imitated 'Native' design, S.O.L.O. aims to create a product with a history. Through consultation and collaboration with the original owners of Indigenous design, S.O.L.O. works to bolster the voice of contemporary Native America and revolutionize industry conceptions of ownership, originality and authenticity. In appreciation for their artistic wisdom and guidance, S.O.L.O. pledges 15% of each sale to the communities that inspire our work. By giving back, we hope to strengthen Native-driven organizations that take pride in tradition and further promote cultural sovereignty." Details: 100% combed cotton. Jersey knit. Tear-away tag. Printed in the USA. Unisex Athletic Fit. *Limited edition colorway for Beyond Buckskin Boutique. This item ships from the US.

name: Beaded Chevron Earrings
description: These diamond-shaped earrings were made with seed beads in glimmering gold, crisp white, creamy cocoa, and accent colors. They measure 1.75" wide and hang 3" long. They were made using the intricate brick stitch technique in which each bead is woven into the form. All items in the Beyond Buckskin Collection were made or hand-selected by Beyond Buckskin author Jessica R. Metcalfe, PhD (Turtle Mountain Chippewa), and all proceeds go directly towards the upkeep of the Beyond Buckskin website and boutique.

name: Brave Necklace Series
description: HOLIDAY SALE: Take 30% off this item, regularly priced $200. While supplies last. This cool necklace was designed by the sister and brother team TSOul. Drawing on their heritage and the colors of the Southwest, the Navajo duo creates cool beaded jewelry in various forms. This necklace features a beaded multi-bar brave necklace made in different patterns on each bar, which is created with size 11 seed beads in various color and metal schemes. The necklace chain measures 20," and the beaded bars measure 3" x 2". Kendra brings the artistic component while Travis handles the business side. Kendra is inspired by nature, classic Navajo rug designs, as well as mathematics and science - her college degree was in engineering, so elements of calculus, organic chemistry and physics inspire her to create three-dimensional shapes for her beadwork and jewelry. This item ships from the US.

Each of these designers present a unique style, informed and shaped by their relationships to their different tribes, communities, cultures and identities. This partnership allowed for this group of artists to share Native American historical legacies of creativity and tradition, while also blending the fun and colorful aesthetic that is Paul Frank. The “Paul Frank Presents” fashion collection includes this tee by Navajo artist Dustin Martin. The tee brings forth traditional geometric patterns while incorporating the playful energy of the Paul Frank company and color palette. The tees are part of a limited edition capsule collection, and are produced in small quantities. Available in Royal Blue100% cotton v-neck and Storm (a dark heathered blue) 60/40 cotton/polyester blend v-neck. Click here to learn more about Dustin Martin on his artist website. Click here to shop other great tees by Dustin on Beyond Buckskin. This item ships from the US.

name: Dentalium Shell Necklace with Russian Blue Beads
description: This necklace was made by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. The necklace measure 27 inches long and features 18 Dentalium Shells and 20 Russian blue beads. These beads are from the Alert Bay/ Fort Rupert area where there was a Hudson's Bay trading post that bought furs from the Kwakwakw'wakw people. These beads have an actual history of being traded in the fur trade. This item ships from Canada. Originally Russian blues were made in Bohemia. They really don’t have a lot to do with Russia. They were actually shipped across Russia to China where they were faceted. The faceted blue beads were then shipped to Alaska and down the North American Coast and into the North American “Northwest”. They appeared in Alaska just prior to the 1870’s. They were popularly traded during the fur trade era. They are glass beads known for their numerous and irregular facets, and blue coloring; transparent and opaque. There were deviations in the number of facets and they were made in white, light blue, and black. The old ones are collectible. Today the new Russian blues, (glass faceted Russian cuts), are known for their beauty. They are made in the Czech Republic in a variety of sizes and colors in fine glass that the Czech Republic is known for.

name: Diné Bizaad Bandana - Purples and Blues
description:
This item was selected by Presence 4.0 style blogger and scholar Jaclyn Roessel as an item to feature in our new P4xBBB collaboration project. Click here to read more and to see how Jaclyn styles this bandana with a dress and her moccasins.
These cool silkscreened bandanas feature an intricate and original design by Navajo artist David Sloan. Images are paired with their name in the Navajo language - so you can learn the Navajo words for things like bicycle, butterfly, helicopter, and penguin. Sloan states, "I hope my art conveys a sense of pride in learning Navajo or any new language and culture. I hope it encourages other people to learn some non-mainstream language also. I hope it conveys an importance to take care of the planet, environment, and our fellow creatures. I feel fortunate to use my imagination to create art." The bandanas are 100% cotton and measure 20" x 20". Wear as a bandana on your head, neck, arm, or leg, or frame it and hang on your wall as fresh Native street art. This item ships from the US.

This necklace features a beaded abstract bird made with size 11 seed beads in jewel tones with baby pink rhinestones. The vintage brass chain measures 18" and the beaded section measures 2" x .5". This item ships from the US. Kendra brings the artistic component while Travis handles the business side. Kendra is inspired by nature, classic Navajo rug designs, as well as mathematics and science - her college degree was in engineering, so elements of calculus, organic chemistry and physics inspire her to create three-dimensional shapes for her beadwork and jewelry.

Kathy explains, "Nature and my culture go hand in hand, and they are my influences. I’m also inspired to be an active participant in the upkeep of Mother Earth by contributing to her healing through the art that I create."

name: Native Americans Discovered Columbus Tee
description:
Every year we celebrate the anniversary of Christopher Columbus's arrival to the Americas. Why? He was no hero. Let's flip this. Reconsider the story of discovery. Wear this tee to show your solidarity with Native Americans. "What represented newness of freedom, hope, and opportunity for some was the occasion for oppression, degradation and genocide for others." - National Council of Churches

This tee was designed by Navajo artist Jared Yazzie for his company OxDx. OxDx features designs that depict American Indian struggles, issues, and art. OxDx is strongly influenced by Native culture, street art, and music. This item ships from the US.

name: Beaded Spike Necklace
description: This beautiful necklace was made by Inuit artist Caroline Blechert. It features spikes made from green and 24k gold-plated delica beads on stroud. The sterling silver chain measures 16.75". This item ships from Canada. Blechert uses porcupine quills in such modern and striking ways that her collections are both memorable and enchanting. She is Inuvialuit, and was born and raised in Yellowknife - a community located in the Northwest Territories of Canada, and this influence of the far north environment is evident in her work.

name: Rebel King Tee
description: This tee was designed by Topah Spoonhunter (Paiute/Northern Arapaho) for his company Two Dogs and a Bear. Sitting Bull, Crazy Horse, Geronimo, Little Wolf, Chief Joseph, Quanah Parker, Red Cloud, Manuelito, Roman Nose, Tall Bull, Looking Glass, Tecumseh, Lone Wolf, Satanta, Morning Star, Gall, Cochise and Captain Jack. These are just some of the great Native leaders. There are many more. These leaders fought for what they believed in and they fought so their people and their culture could live on. This design is printed on a standard unisex 100% cotton shirt that is pre-shrunk. Available in Black or Dark Green. To select your perfect fit, measurements for the Body Width of each tee is as follows: S=18", Medium/Large =20", Large/XL=22", XL/2XL=24." This item ships from the US.

name: Failsafe Tee
description: This tee was designed by Topah Spoonhunter (Paiute/Northern Arapaho) for his company Two Dogs and a Bear. The bow and arrow is a simple, reliable and very effective weapon. Even after the introduction of firearms the bow and arrow was used on a regular basis. Due to the lack of ammunition and with many guns being unreliable the bow and arrow was used for hunting and was often carried into battle alongside a rifle or pistol. Whenever a gun failed or when ammunition was depleted the bow and arrow became the plan b. The Failsafe. This design is printed on a unisex white 100% cotton tee or a grey cotton/polyester shirt. The sizing for the white tee runs large (so if you normally wear a Large, order a Medium) and is as follows: Body Width: S=18", M=20", L=22", XL=24". Sizing for the Grey option is standard. This item ships from the US.

name: Paul Frank x Candace Halcro Sunglasses (Unisex)
description: This exciting collection presents a collaboration between Paul Frank and four Native American designers. Each of these designers present a unique style, informed and shaped by their relationships to their different tribes, communities, cultures and identities. This partnership allowed for this group of artists to share Native American historical legacies of creativity and tradition, while also blending the fun and colorful aesthetic that is Paul Frank. The “Paul Frank Presents” fashion collection includes these authentic Paul Frank hand-beaded sunglasses by Cree/Metis artist Candace Halcro. The frames are high-quality and sturdy and feature a unique design by Halcro that perfectly fuses traditional Cree/Metis beadwork with the fun Paul Frank color palette. Each pair has a metal plate on the left side that reads Paul Frank. The glasses are part of a capsule collection that is extremely limited edition, and are hand-beaded in small quantities by the artist. Candace said, "This opportunity to work together with Paul Frank is amazing. I think it's going to give us a chance to be seen in a different light -- not only the artists involved with this particular collaboration, but First Nations artists as a whole. description:
SALE!: Order now and get these for our lowest possible price. Original price $45. Limited quantities. This item was selected by Presence 4.0 style blogger and scholar Nanibaa Beck as an item to feature in our new P4xBBB collaboration project. Click here to read more and to see how Nanibaa styles these earrings with a yellow blouse, shorts and her moccasins.

These brilliant earrings come to us by the creative hands of Chickasaw metalsmith Kristen Dorsey. The Blood Quantum earrings comment on the current system of counting the degree of Indian blood that someone possesses. Race and culture have both been subjects of Dorsey’s jewelry designs in the past. Featuring customizable fractions, you can select your two numbers from the drop down menu below. Select a 3 and a 2 for 1/32. Or a 1 and 1 for "full" and so on. Don't like the government's system of math? Me neither. So do your own math. Feel free to select numbers of significance to you. The earrings are enhanced with verticle lazer-cut lines to represent bar codes, and the shape of each earring echos a drop of blood or tear drops, adding further meaning to this political bling. "Through the adornment I create, I seek to foster intelligent discussions about issues of race and identity in Native America while creating awareness of how specific historical events are often the triggers of our current perceptions of Native identity.” - Kristen Dorsey The earrings are copper on sterling silver ear wires and measure 2" long by 1.25" wide. This item ships from the US.

Let's fill bookshelves, coffee tables, and libraries everywhere with this cool new version of Native style. Buy copies for your friends, daughters, sons, and relatives. See and experience it yourself and join us in celebrating Native American fashion designers and artists! It's a great time to be Indigenous. Click here to read more about the project. name: Trade Bead Necklace
description: This necklace was made by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. The necklace measure 18 inches long and features Russian blue beads, Hudson Bay white hearts, China black beads and red seed beads. These beads are from the Alert Bay/ Fort Rupert area where there was a Hudson's Bay trading post that bought furs from the Kwakwakw'wakw people. These beads have an actual history of being traded in the fur trade. Hudson bay white hearts were traded during the fur trade era. In the mid-1800’s they became known as Hudson Bay beads. They had two distinct colors of glass – one layered over the other. The outer layer was red and the inside layer was green, yellow, or white. The newer versions of the Hudson Bay beads are known as white hearts and have a white inner layer and a clear glass exterior from the range of the rainbow colors. Sizes and shapes vary. They are made today in France, Czech Republic, and India. Originally Russian blues were made in Bohemia. They really don’t have a lot to do with Russia. They were actually shipped across Russia to China where they were faceted. The faceted blue beads were then shipped to Alaska and down the North American Coast and into the North American “Northwest”. They appeared in Alaska just prior to the 1870’s. They were popularly traded during the fur trade era. They are glass beads known for their numerous and irregular facets, and blue coloring; transparent and opaque. There were deviations in the number of facets and they were made in white, light blue, and black. The old ones are collectible. Today the new Russian blues, (glass faceted Russian cuts), are known for their beauty. They are made in the Czech Republic in a variety of sizes and colors in fine glass that the Czech Republic is known for. This item ships from Canada.

name: Paul Frank x Dustin Martin Tee (Unisex)
description: This exciting collection presents a collaboration between Paul Frank and four Native American designers. Each of these designers present a unique style, informed and shaped by their relationships to their different tribes, communities, cultures and identities. This partnership allowed for this group of artists to share Native American historical legacies of creativity and tradition, while also blending the fun and colorful aesthetic that is Paul Frank. The “Paul Frank Presents” fashion collection includes this tee by Navajo artist Dustin Martin. The tee brings forth traditional geometric patterns while incorporating the playful energy of the Paul Frank company and color palette. About the design, Dustin explained, "My contribution to the line was built on the concept ‘Point Lips, Not Fingers.’ When I was growing up, my grandfather taught me it was rude to point fingers (literally and figuratively). So, like many Navajos who grow up on the rez, I learned that pointing my lips was a polite alternative to conventional hand gestures. "The design I cooked up uses a cultural quirk (lip-pointing) to embed meaning and humor into the image and remind viewers of what sparked the collaboration. Graphic silhouettes of a Dine man and woman are met by Julius (Paul Frank’s signature brand character) lost on a hike through Native America. Their pointed lips show that the monkey’s childish curiosity has been met with patience and respect rather than gesticulating rudeness. "Elsewhere in the design you’ll see the Paul Frank brand surrounded by (and integrated into) familiar ‘Native’ geometry. But these perfectly symmetrical shapes evolve into abstract fields of modern-looking angles. These jarring shapes imply new directions -- for thoughts, for friendships, for artistic traditions, for brands. Fresh trails can only be blazed with the help of patient and forward-thinking guides. These guides point lips, not fingers." The tees are part of a limited edition capsule collection, and are produced in small quantities. Available in white and grey crew neck tees. Click here to learn more about Dustin Martin on his artist website. Click here to shop other great tees by Dustin on Beyond Buckskin. This item ships from the US.

name: Silver Hoops with White Heart and China Black Beads
description: These earrings were made by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. These earrings measure 1" x 1" and feature ancient artifacts that date back to the 1800's. These beads are from the Alert Bay/ Fort Rupert area where there was a Hudson's Bay trading post that bought furs from the Kwakwakw'wakw people. These beads have an actual history of being traded in the fur trade. The Hudson Bay white heart beads were traded during the fur trade era. In the mid-1800’s they became known as Hudson Bay beads. They had two distinct colors of glass – one layered over the other. The outer layer was red and the inside layer was green, yellow, or white. The newer versions of the Hudson Bay beads are known as white hearts and have a white inner layer and a clear glass exterior from the range of the rainbow colors. Sizes and shapes vary. They are made today in France, Czech Republic, and India. The China black beads never became very popular as there were too many of them. Nonetheless, they were used in beadwork. Collectors do not consider them too valuable. This item ships from Canada.

name: Aztec Woman Tee
description: This tee was designed by Navajo artist Jared Yazzie for his company OxDx. Yazzie was inspired by the sugar skulls of the Day of the Dead celebrations that focus on praying for and remembering friends and family members who have passed on. The holiday can be traced back hundreds of years to Indigenous observances and to ancient Aztec traditions dedicated to the goddess Mictecacihuatl. She keeps watch over the bones of the deceased. OxDx features designs that depict American Indian struggles, issues, and art. OxDx is strongly influenced by Native culture, street art, and music. The design is printed on a unisex Fine Jersey (100% Cotton) construction American Apparel tee - the softest, smoothest, best-looking short sleeve tee shirt available anywhere.

name: Single Navajo Button Post Earrings
description: These earrings were designed by Wayne Nez Gaussoin (Navajo/Picuris Pueblo). These single (post) "Navajo Button" earrings are handcrafted out of sterling silver. They are lightweight. They were shaped using a traditional handmade die form. This shape is traditionally seen on Navajo (Dine) moccasins, men's and women's shirts. Gaussoin's contemporary interpretation of the traditional look creates an open free flowing feel with a drilled texture and a rustic black patina and can be worn with any style to either dress them up or dress them down. This item ships from the US.

name: Runway Bound Bracelet
description: This sleek double-band bracelet was made with diamond metal plate aluminum by award-winning artist David Gaussoin. David Gaussoin comes from a long line of artists, including silversmiths, painters, rug weavers, sculptors, and wood workers. He creates wearable art for the body with gold, silver, and precious and semiprecious stones, as well as unconventional materials, such as steel and aluminum. For the Beyond Buckskin Boutique, Gaussoin brings us a 'high street' collection of jewelry cut from diamond plated aluminum. Diamond plate is often used on stairs and catwalks in industrial settings (the added texture reduces the risk of slipping), but it is also used on the interior of ambulances and on the sides of firetrucks. While Gaussoin references the street, his couture pieces are clearly high fashion and high quality - and belong on the runway. This bracelet measures 2" x 2.5" x 2". Shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Diamond Plate Fashion Earrings
description: This hand-fabricated set of earrings was created using diamond metal plate aluminum by award-winning artist David Gaussoin. David Gaussoin comes from a long line of artists, including silversmiths, painters, rug weavers, sculptors, and wood workers. He creates wearable art for the body with gold, sterling silver, and various precious and semiprecious stones, as well as materials not necessarily associated with jewelry, such as steel and aluminum. For the Beyond Buckskin Boutique, Gaussoin brings us a 'high street' collection of jewelry cut from diamond plated aluminum. Diamond plate is often used on stairs and catwalks in industrial settings (the added texture reduces the risk of slipping), but it is also used on the interior of ambulances and on the sides of firetrucks. While Gaussoin references the street, his pieces are clearly high fashion - this stuff belongs on the runway. The Small set measures 3" x .5". The Medium set measures 3.5" x .5". The Large set measures 4.5" x .5". Price of shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Squash Blossom Pendant
description: This hand-fabricated pendant was made by award-winning artist David Gaussoin. It features wax cast Sterling silver and stainless steel wire. It measures approximately 2.5" x 2.5." David Gaussoin comes from a long line of artists, including silversmiths, painters, rug weavers, sculptors, and wood workers. He creates wearable art for the body with gold, silver, and precious and semiprecious stones, as well as unconventional materials, such as steel and aluminum. Price of shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Eagle Feather Scarf by Patricia Michaels
description: These elegant hand-painted silk organza scarves were made by award-winning Taos Pueblo fashion designer Patricia Michaels and incorporate an eagle feather design pattern. Each line on every scarf is hand painted. This item ships from the US. Her work blends her traditional Pueblo heritage with inspiration drawn from the ever-changing world around her, including elements from the natural environment, such as feathers and water, and aspects of city life, such as buildings and slick streets. Michaels’ work is elegant, fluid, sophisticated, and organic. Due to participation in Project Runway events, orders from this artist may take up to 4 weeks for delivery. We appreciate your support!

name: Sky Serpent Statement Necklace
description: For a limited time, get this stunning Sky Serpent Statement Necklace for only $600. Regularly priced $850. Limited quantities. This Sky Serpent statement necklace was designed by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. Hand-sculpted silver scales in cloud-like formations reference the sky serpent being of the timeless Native American Southeastern cultures. Dorsey seeks to bring the power and beauty of ancient Southeast Native American symbols to the present through her exquisite jewelry collections. Always an eye on the past, Dorsey brings the meanings and stories forward with each of her creations. Her work reflects Chickasaw cultural values, history, and jewelry traditions, as well as the natural beauty of her home in southern California. This statement necklace was made with sterling silver and pyrite. It is adjustable from 16"-18." This item ships from the US.

name: Navajo Silver and Mosaic Bead Necklace
description: This necklace was designed and handmade by Navajo artist JT Willie. It boasts handmade sterling silver beads that have been oxidized for an old-style finish, alongside mother of pearl mosaic-style beads. The necklace is finished with sterling silver cones and hook-and-eye clasp. The JT Willie artist tag is attached in sterling silver. The necklace measures 20 inches long. This item ships from the US. Originally from Twin Lakes, New Mexico, Willie started beading as a teenager, learning techniques from his family, beaders, steamstress, and silversmiths. At the age of 16, he learned the style of beadwork from the Kiowa and Comanche Tribes of Oklahoma. He researches different styles of beadwork and incorporates them into his own unique style.

This Sky Serpent Pendant was made by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. Hand-sculpted silver scales in cloud-like formations reference the sky serpent being of the timeless Native American Southeastern cultures. Dorsey seeks to bring the power and beauty of ancient Southeast Native American symbols to the present through her exquisite jewelry collections. Always an eye on the past, Dorsey brings the meanings and stories forward with each of her creations. Her work reflects Chickasaw cultural values, history, and jewelry traditions, as well as the natural beauty of her home in southern California. The pendant is made of Sterling Silver with a graduated black freshwater pearl fringe or pyrite fringe. It measures 1.6"x 2.2" wide, and hangs 30" on a triple strand silver chain. This item ships from the US.

The earrings are made with sterling silver and are available in graduated black freshwater pearl, pyrite or moonstone (see options below). The earrings measure 1.8 " long x 1.25 " wide. Always an eye on the past, Dorsey brings the meanings and stories forward with each of her creations. Her work reflects Chickasaw cultural values, history, and jewelry traditions, as well as the natural beauty of her home in southern California.

name: Teardrop Earrings
description:
These hand-fabricated earrings were made by award-winning artist David Gaussoin. They feature elongated sterling silver 'teardrops'. They measure a perfect 3" long.

David Gaussoin comes from a long line of artists, including silversmiths, painters, rug weavers, sculptors, and wood workers. He creates wearable art for the body with gold, silver, and precious and semiprecious stones, as well as unconventional materials, such as steel and aluminum. Price of shipping and handling included. name: “Giving Life” Reticulated Flower Bracelet
description: This bracelet was made by Kathy Whitman-Elk Woman (Mandan / Hidatsa / Arikara). This one-of-a-kind bracelet is made with sterling silver and druzy. Kathy explains, "Nature and my culture go hand in hand, and they are my influences. I’m also inspired to be an active participant in the upkeep of Mother Earth by contributing to her healing through the art that I create." This item ships from the US.

name: Butterfly and Shells Necklace
description:
This necklace was made by Hupa/Tolowa jewelry artist Pamela Mattz.  It features black glass beads that measure .5" in width alongside acrylic black butterflies of the same size. Clear and black beads are strung throughout this single strand necklace with sterling silver hardware. It can be worn as one 52” long single-strand necklace or can be doubled and worn as a two-strand necklace. Each shell has a unique personality, and the patterns on the discs, while all reflect beautiful pinks and greens, will differ slightly from shell to shell. This item ships from the US.

Mattz's jewelry is inspired by age-old Pacific Northwest California Native American adornment traditions.

name: “Bringing it ALL Together” Necklace
description: This bracelet was made by Kathy Whitman-Elk Woman (Mandan / Hidatsa / Arikara). This one-of-a-kind necklace is made with sterling silver and druzy. It measures 25” long, and the center piece measures 4” X 2”. This item ships from the US. Kathy explains, "Nature and my culture go hand in hand, and they are my influences. I’m also inspired to be an active participant in the upkeep of Mother Earth by contributing to her healing through the art that I create.
