name: Diamond Barnacle Ring
description: Perfect for summer these barnacle rings are hand carved by award winning Chickasaw artist Kristen Dorsey. They come in black rhodium plated sterling silver set with .41 carats of black conflict-free diamonds, or in sterling silver set with .41 carats of champagne diamonds. This item ships from the US. Available in the following sizes: 5 - 8.5 (see the drop down menu below). Please allow up to 2 weeks for the order to be filled. Price of US shipping and handling included.

name: Gunmetal Dress
description: This dress was designed by Navajo fashion designer Consuelo Pascual and is made of gunmetal grey metallic crinkle taffeta. It features hand-pleated detailing on the front. This item ships from the US. Pascual's designs for sale on the Beyond Buckskin Boutique are chic futuristic dresses - influenced by the blackness of outer space, the glimmer of stars, and the architecture of a fluid space ship. Working with a palette of mostly black, silver, and grey, her work is meticulously constructed. She also plays with fabric texture, and her latest pieces feature variations of pleats - the intricate detailing of which is time consuming yet stunning. The designs formed by pleating has Pascual creating varying silhouettes, and this, combined with her space cadet aesthetic, creates an exciting new path for Native fashion.

name: Paul Frank x Candace Halcro Sunglasses (Round)
description: This exciting collection presents a collaboration between Paul Frank and four Native American designers. Each of these designers present a unique style, informed and shaped by their relationships to their different tribes, communities, cultures and identities. This partnership allowed for this group of artists to share Native American historical legacies of creativity and tradition, while also blending the fun and colorful aesthetic that is Paul Frank. The “Paul Frank Presents” fashion collection includes these authentic Paul Frank hand-beaded sunglasses by Cree/Metis artist Candace Halcro. The frames are high-quality and sturdy and feature a unique design by Halcro that perfectly fuses traditional Cree/Metis beadwork with the fun Paul Frank color palette. Each pair has a metal plate on the left side that reads Paul Frank. The glasses are part of a capsule collection that is extremely limited edition, and are hand-beaded in small quantities by the artist. Candace said, "This opportunity to work together with Paul Frank is amazing. I think it's going to give us a chance to be seen in a different light -- not only the artists involved with this particular collaboration, but First Nations artists as a whole. Being able to show our culture, and to help give exposure to other First Nation designers out there with amazing talents, is very exciting." Click here to learn more about Candace Halcro and to shop directly from the artist. Click here to shop other great styles of beaded sunglasses by Candace.

name: Everything in Its Right Place
description:
These earrings are designed and hand-beaded by Navajo artist Andrea Preston. Each pair are delicately made with Size 11 and 15 seed beads of various colors and finishes.
 
This pair measures at 2.5 inches, and makes for the perfect dangled ear accessory. All beaded earrings are finished with 14k gold earring hooks and hardware. Free shipping w/ tracking included.(Available in Purple and Blue). This item ships from the US.

Preston's jewelry is a fusion of bright colors, geometric designs and powwow aesthetics. Silver and gold metallic accents and a sense of cool '80s inspiration give her earrings a fresh urban feel. This pair is elegantly and perfectly constructed, with straight lines and precisely placed beads. Working with a rich color palette, these earrings will stand out and match all your favorite outfits.

name: Hipsters in Headdresses Neckties
description:
This necktie was designed by Nicholas Galanin (Tlingit/Aleut) for Dick Bernanin Menswear. It features the abstracted faces of hipsters in headdresses. The tie launched in conjunction with Galanin's "I Looooove Your Culture" exhibit in Vancouver and is sold exclusively through Beyond Buckskin Boutique. 

Galanin’s work is a highly charged mix of beauty, material knowledge, politics and contemporary cultural representation. Navigating both the Native American art world as well as the contemporary global art world, Galanin continuously challenges the aesthetic and cultural perceptions of Native identity.

Lavender Necktie Details: White Ink on Lavender Standard Tie. 100% Polyester. Measures 57” x 3.25". All dryclean only, iron on low heat.  This item ships from the US.

name: Don't Trend On Me (Women's V-Neck)
description: This tee was designed by Navajo artist Jared Yazzie for his company OxDx. He states, "Models, actresses, and sports fans in headdresses do nothing but offend and discriminate my beloved culture. It's time to end the trend and speak up for Native people." The "Don't Trend on Me" statement can refer to the wearer, but perhaps more importantly it also refers to the chief pictured on the tee, as if he is saying it, speaking from the past to us now. OxDx features designs that depict American Indian struggles, issues, and art. OxDx is strongly influenced by Native culture, street art, and music. Wear in solidarity.

name: Empower Earrings
description: These earrings were made by Kathy Whitman-Elk Woman (Mandan / Hidatsa / Arikara). They are made from recycled aluminum cans and Swarovski Crystals (colors may vary depending on can). They measure 2.5” round, and are available in 10 color options: Black, Blue, Purple, Green, Red, Orange, Yellow, Pink, Brown, and White. This item ships from the US. Kathy explains, "Nature and my culture go hand in hand, and they are my influences. I’m also inspired to be an active participant in the upkeep of Mother Earth by contributing to her healing through the art that I create. By using materials, that are byproducts of consumer goods for my medium, I could accomplish this idea and this purpose. I chose aluminum cans and plastic bottles because they seem to be two of the most abundant land pollutants in the world. For every can and plastic bottle that becomes a part my art, that much less is put into the environment. Through this body of work, my hope is to change the perspective of the general public, to raise the consciousness about our impact on the environment and make positive changes, no matter how minute they may seem, and to broaden the minds to new possibilities of using byproduct materials to create fine art, therefore saving the environment and impacting all of life."

name: Milo Creations Tee
description: This tee was designed by Michelle Lowden (Acoma) and features a central circular Acoma Pueblo design. Made of 100% fine ring-spun combed cotton, this finer 1x1 rib knit features a comfortable stretch with excellent durability through repeated washings. This item ships from the US. Lowden specializes in hand-made jewelry painted with geometric designs on lightweight basswood. Although the designs have a distinctive pop/street feel, all of her inspiration actually comes from traditional Acoma pottery, which is widely known for its historic intricate and geometric patterns. Some of her earrings stick to the black and white palette of Acoma pottery, others go beyond, and fuse pinks and with greens or yellows with blues.

name: First American Art Magazine
description:
First American Art Magazine is a new magazine dedicated solely to the arts of Indigenous peoples of the Americas and is written by Native American authors, artists, and critics. 

Issue 0 marks the introductory pilot issue launched in April 2013. This volume includes the following feature articles:
- "More Than Just a Trend: Rethinking the 'Native' in Native Fashion," by Dr. Jessica Metcalfe (Turtle Mountain Chippewa)
- "Northern Lights: Greenlandic Art in the 21st Century," by America Meredith (Cherokee Nation)
- "Something Imperialistic Happened on the Way to the Louvre: Delegation Amérindienne 2012, An Artist's Perspective," by Roy Boney, Jr. (Cherokee Nation)

Issue 0 also features Exhibit Reviews, Book Reviews, and Artist Profiles on Orlando Dugi (Navajo), Anita Fields (Osage-Muscogee Creek), Tom Jones (Ho-Chunk), and Erin Shaw (Chickasaw–Choctaw).

Issue 1, launched in August, includes the following feature articles:
- Cultural Heritage, Art and Living Beings: Justice Lost in Translation, by Suzan Shown Harjo (Cheyenne-Holdulgee Muscogee)
- First Nations and Alaska Native Artists Experiences Exhibiting in the Southwest, by RoseMary Diaz (Tewa)
- The Revival of Southeastern Woodland Beadwork, by America Meredith (Cherokee Nation)
- Cultural sensitivity and sacred objects, by Suzan Shown Harjo, PhD (Cheyenne-Hodulgee Muscogee)

Issue 1 also features Exhibit Reviews, Book Reviews, and Artist Profiles on Nani Chacon (Diné-Xicana), Shan Goshorn (Eastern Band Cherokee), Dylan Miner (Métis), and Kenneth Williams (Northern Arapaho-Seneca).

name: Kimiwan Zine
description:
Kimiwan is a quarterly publication that showcases words and art from Indigenous, First Nations, Métis, and Inuit writers and artists. This zine is based out of Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, in Treaty Six Territory. Kimiwan translates to mean 'rain' in nehiyawewin (Plains Cree). 

Their second issue, Sīkwan (Spring), features the following contributors: Andy Everson, Bradlee LaRocque, Cheyenne Randall, David Groulx, Elizabeth LaPensée, Emberlee Daniels, Howard Adler, Jarita Greyeyes, Jesus Barraza, Julia Hepburn, Susan Blight and Hayden King, Lesley Belleau, Melody Wood, Nowuhquay geezhigoquay (Rebecca Beaulne-Stuebing), Nathan Adler, Ronnie Dean Harris, Rosanna Deerchild, Sâkihitowin Awâsis, Sonny Assu, Tenille Campbell, Waaseyaa’sin Christine Sy, and cover by Jason Baerg. 7.5" x 9.5" - 48 pages.

Their third issue, Nīpin (Summer), features written works by Darryl Chamakese, Dr. Dawn Karima Pettigrew, Jason Chamakese, Karrie Oliver, Lani Elliot, Leah Marie Dorion, Melody Wood, and more. Visual art from Carol Daniels, Catherine Blackburn, Dylan Miner, Eric Keast, Francine Cunningham, Geraldine Carriere, Jessica Wood, Jordan Bennett, Kevin Cardinal, Kevin Wesaquate, and more, with cover art by Erin Marie Konsmo. 7.5" x 9.5" - 44 pages.

Their fourth issue, Takwākin (Fall), features Ahimsa Timoteo Bodhrán Cecelia Rose LaPointe, Christian Chapman, Cindy Roberts, Janet Marie Rogers, Judy Chartrand, Kai Minosh Pyle, Leonard Sumner, Megan Currie, Nathan Adler, Priscilla Settee, Sâkihitowin Awâsis, Victoria Ransom, Walking With Our Sisters: Interview with Christi Belcourt, and Cover art by Marika Swan. 7.5" x 9.5" - 44 pages.

name: Lone Resistance Tee
description: This tee was designed by Navajo artist Dustin Martin for his company SOLO (Sovereign Original Land Owners). Inspired by the work of Laura Gilpin and her 1968 photo essay The Enduring Navajo, this design is meant to give survival a face. Cloaked in a robe of history and cultural pride, Sovereign Original Land Owners forge toward the future while remembering the wisdom of their ancestors. "In a market flooded with uninformed and poorly imitated 'Native' design, S.O.L.O. aims to create a product with a history. Through consultation and collaboration with the original owners of Indigenous design, S.O.L.O. works to bolster the voice of contemporary Native America and revolutionize industry conceptions of ownership, originality and authenticity. In appreciation for their artistic wisdom and guidance, S.O.L.O. pledges 15% of each sale to the communities that inspire our work. By giving back, we hope to strengthen Native-driven organizations that take pride in tradition and further promote cultural sovereignty." Details: Limited edition colorway for the Beyond Buckskin Boutique. Gallup Red design on Juniper Green shirt. 100% combed cotton. Jersey knit. Tear-Away Tag. Printed in the USA. Unisex Athletic Fit. This item ships from the US.

name: Leather and Feather Tassel
description: This beautiful leather tassel was designed and created by Dene artist Nathalie Waldman and features a concho and feathers. It measures 9" and can hook onto your purse, your jeans, or anything else, and adds instant beauty to any item! Waldman is a member of the Dene First Nation Dogrib Tribe located in the Northwest Territories, Canada. This item ships from the US.

name: Nathalie Waldman & Max Early Saddle Bag
description: This exquisite saddle bag was designed and created by Yellowknives Dene First Nations artist Nathalie Waldman in collaboration with Laguna Pueblo potter, Max Early. It features a one-of-a-kind painting by Early. The bag is also embellished with long flowing fringes and silver conchos. Each bag is constructed by hand by Waldman so each is unique and slightly different. The bag measures 28" x 11". This item ships from the US. Max Early was born into the Turkey Clan of his mother and Bear Clan of his father at Laguna Pueblo. He grew up with his grandparents. During his early teenage years, he painted some of his grandmother’s pottery. He refined his technique to a personal touch, while maintaining traditional Laguna design symbols and compositions. Waldman is a member of the Dene First Nation Dogrib Tribe located in the Northwest Territories, Canada.

name: Nathalie Waldman & Max Early Large Shoulder Bag
description: HOLIDAY SALE! For a limited time, get this purse on sale for $175, regularly priced $350. This luxurious large shoulder bag was designed and created by Yellowknives Dene First Nations artist Nathalie Waldman in collaboration with Laguna Pueblo potter, Max Early. It features a hand-painted one-of-a-kind design by Early. Each bag is constructed by hand by Waldman so each is unique and slightly different. The bag measures 24" x 17.5". This item ships from the US and mails within 1 business day. Max Early was born into the Turkey Clan of his mother and Bear Clan of his father at Laguna Pueblo. He grew up with his grandparents. During his early teenage years, he painted some of his grandmother’s pottery. He refined his technique to a personal touch, while maintaining traditional Laguna design symbols and compositions. Waldman is a member of the Dene First Nation Dogrib Tribe located in the Northwest Territories, Canada.

name: Woven Cedar Earrings with Black Agate
description: These earrings were made by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. These handwoven twined cedar bark earrings are rectangular and feature black agate stone. The earrings measure 2.25" x 1.5" and hang on copper hooks. This item ships from Canada. O’Brien weaves baskets, hats and jewelry with red and yellow cedar bark using twining and plaiting forms of weaving. Cedar bark weaving has been part of the culture of the peoples of the Northwest Coast for thousands of years; it was and continues to be an integral part of the culture. The process is deeply spiritual: beginning with an offering of tobacco to give thanks to the tree for its offering, O’Brien then strips, soaks, and prepares the bark to be woven. It is a way to carry on the traditional ways of her ancestors, and share this medicine with the world. The pricing of her art is based on the amount of time spent harvesting the bark, preparation and weaving time, finish and type of weave.

name: Birch Bark Earrings
description: These 2.75" long rectangular earrings were made with bark that has been harvested in a good way from birch trees in the Turtle Mountains. This beautiful bark has been used for centuries by Native American people of the woodlands area to make a variety of important utilitarian and sacred objects. The durable bark ranges in color from a warm yellow tan, to a soft pink, to a creamy white hue. Price of shipping and handling included. All items in the Beyond Buckskin Collection were made or hand-selected by Beyond Buckskin author Jessica R. Metcalfe, PhD (Turtle Mountain Chippewa), and all proceeds go directly towards the upkeep of the Beyond Buckskin website and boutique.

name: Abalone Rounds
description:
These earrings were made by Hupa/Tolowa jewelry artist Pamela Mattz. They feature beautiful round abalone shell discs hanging on sterling silver hooks. Also available in blue green. The earrings hang 2.5" long, and the discs measure 2" diameter. Each shell has a unique personality, and the patterns on the discs, while all reflect beautiful pinks and greens, will differ slightly from shell to shell, and from earring to earring. This item ships from the US.

Mattz's jewelry is inspired by age-old Pacific Northwest California Native American adornment traditions. The price of shipping is included for this item.

name: BBB Promo Pack
description:
We don’t have a budget for advertising to compete with large non-Native businesses so we rely on guerrilla ad campaigns and tactics that require creativity and involve word of mouth. Get the BBB Promo Pack for only $1 (to cover postage), and help us spread the word about Native American-made fashion. This pack comes with the following:

-	10 BBB 3”x4” Stickers to stick all over your home or office, or all over town, where ever
-	2 BBB Fashion Collage Postcards with prepaid stamps to send off to your besties
-	1 BBB 2"x3.5" Magnet for your fridge or filing cabinet or other metal surface
-	Various BBB artist business cards

name: Dew Drop Earrings
description: These Dew Drop earrings were made by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. In this set, exquisitely cut white topaz stones are framed by rippling organic silver evoking the purity of morning dew. These are molded from an original piece which was hand fabricated through the ancient technique of creating relief sculpture using pitch, a sap-like substance used to support the metal as the artist works it with specialized tools. These earrings are made using sterling silver with white topaz. The earrings measure 1" wide by 1.8" long. Price of US shipping and handling included. Expedited 2-3 day shipping available for an additional $25, see drop-down menu.

name: Water Disk Earrings
description: These pretty water disk earrings were designed by Chickasaw metalsmith Kristen Dorsey. The iconic Water Disk Collection evokes the frothy pattern of foam made after a wave breaks. As an homage to the rivers of the Chickasaw homelands, these sterling silver water disk earrings are adorned with Black Freshwater Pearls, Labradorite, Moonstone, or Pyrite. Dimensions: 1" x 2" long. This item ships from the US. Price of US shipping and handling included. Expedited 2-3 day shipping available for an additional $25, see drop-down menu.

name: Six Mountain Necklace
description: HOLIDAY SALE: Take 30% off this item, regularly priced $250. While supplies last. This cool necklace was designed by the sister and brother team TSOul. Drawing on their heritage and the colors of the Southwest, the Navajo duo creates cool beaded jewelry in various forms. This necklace features six individually beaded mountains created with seed beads in matte black, regular black, and tricut beads to add sparkle. The beaded mountains hang on two tiers of gunmetal chains. A piece of Hubei turquoise accents the piece. This item ships from the US. Kendra brings the artistic component while Travis handles the business side. Kendra is inspired by nature, classic Navajo rug designs, as well as mathematics and science - her college degree was in engineering, so elements of calculus, organic chemistry and physics inspire her to create three-dimensional shapes for her beadwork and jewelry.

name: Chippewow Blossoms
description: Beauty, knowledge and design come together in this collaboration between Beyond Buckskin and Mea B’Fly. The title of these earrings, Chippewow Blossoms, highlights the 'wow' factor of the beautiful floral beadwork created by Chippewa women for the past couple hundred years. While this style of beadwork was commonly associated with the Indians of the Woodlands area, the technique can now be found practiced by Native American artists throughout North America. And this, I think, reflects a blossoming of our Native cultures, like a perennial flower that had to go dormant through winter due to harsh conditions, now is our Indigenous spring. This item ships from the US.

artists.name: MaRia Bird (Navajo / Hopi / Santa Clara Pueblo)

name: Nashdoitsoh Bitsiiji Dahditl'ooigii (Lion) Belt Buckle
description: This sterling silver belt buckle was made by Navajo artist David Sloan and is fabricated from a found object using the lost cast technique. It features a central lion figure and the Navajo words Nashdoitsoh Bitsiiji Dahditl'ooigii (Lion). It measures 2.75" x 1.75" x .75." Price of shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Follow My Trax
description: This beautiful cuff bracelet was made with diamond metal plate aluminum by award-winning artist David Gaussoin. David Gaussoin comes from a long line of artists, including silversmiths, painters, rug weavers, sculptors, and wood workers. He creates wearable art for the body with gold, silver, and precious and semiprecious stones, as well as unconventional materials, such as steel and aluminum. This item ships from the US. For the Beyond Buckskin Boutique, Gaussoin brings us a 'high street' collection of jewelry cut from diamond plated aluminum. Diamond plate is often used on stairs and catwalks in industrial settings (the added texture reduces the risk of slipping), but it is also used on the interior of ambulances and on the sides of firetrucks. While Gaussoin references the street, his couture pieces are clearly high fashion and high quality - and belong on the runway. This bracelet measures 3" x 2.5" x 3". Shipping and handling included.

name: Post Anasazi Earrings
description: These earrings were designed by Wayne Nez Gaussoin (Navajo/Picuris Pueblo). The inspiration for these earrings came from many of the spiral shape that you find within many petroglyphs throughout New Mexico and the greater southwest. They are all sterling silver- These ones in particular have a textured pattern on the inside. This item ships from the US.

options.name: Silver with gun metal black patina

name: Feather Earrings
description: These earrings were made by Kathy Whitman-Elk Woman (Mandan / Hidatsa / Arikara). They are made from recycled aluminum cans and Swarovski Crystals (colors may vary depending on can). They measure 3" x .75" long, and are available in the following color options: Black, Blue, Pink, Yellow, Red. This item ships from the US. Kathy explains, "Nature and my culture go hand in hand, and they are my influences. I’m also inspired to be an active participant in the upkeep of Mother Earth by contributing to her healing through the art that I create. By using materials, that are byproducts of consumer goods for my medium, I could accomplish this idea and this purpose. I chose aluminum cans and plastic bottles because they seem to be two of the most abundant land pollutants in the world. For every can and plastic bottle that becomes a part my art, that much less is put into the environment. Through this body of work, my hope is to change the perspective of the general public, to raise the consciousness about our impact on the environment and make positive changes, no matter how minute they may seem, and to broaden the minds to new possibilities of using byproduct materials to create fine art, therefore saving the environment and impacting all of life."

name: Silver Hoops with Hudson Bay White Hearts
description: These earrings were made by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. These earrings measure .75" x .75" and feature ancient artifacts that date back to the 1800's. These beads are from the Alert Bay/ Fort Rupert area where there was a Hudson's Bay trading post that bought furs from the Kwakwakw'wakw people. These beads have an actual history of being traded in the fur trade. Hudson Bay white hearts were traded during the fur trade era. In the mid-1800’s they became known as Hudson Bay beads. They had two distinct colors of glass – one layered over the other. The outer layer was red and the inside layer was green, yellow, or white. The newer versions of the Hudson Bay beads are known as white hearts and have a white inner layer and a clear glass exterior from the range of the rainbow colors. Sizes and shapes vary. They are made today in France, Czech Republic, and India. This item ships from Canada.

name: Pathways: Earthen"wear" Earrings - The Red Collection
description: These handmade micaceous clay earrings were created by Courtney M. Leonard (Shinnecock Nation). The earrings are a part of her "Pathways" design series. Each piece is unique, one-of-a-kind, and handmade. Designs may be replicated but will never be exactly the same, much like the paths we take in life. Leonard views jewelry as an extension of our bodies and our minds, and the patterns on the discs reflect magnified aspects of our stamped records of time. Each recalls history and our cultural landscape. The earrings measure 1.5" in diameter and hang on 14k gold plated findings. This item ships from the US. Interested in ideas of jewelry as human architecture, Leonard is an artist and filmmaker whose work explores the evolution of language, image and culture through various media including video, audio, and tangible objects. She currently lives in Santa Fe, New Mexico and works as a professional artist, lecturer, and Adjunct Faculty at the Institute of American Indian Arts.

name: Red Sea Monster Tunic Dress
description: This red Sea Monster tunic dress was designed by Tahltan artist Alano Edzerza. It features a sleek and bold all-over 'Sea Monster' design that has been silk-screened onto a stylish red tunic dress. The fabric is 100% Fine Jersey cotton construction. The medium sized tunic is approximately 33" in total length. The tunic is loose-fitting on top, snug around bottom, and has raw edges. A rising star in the fashion world, Edzerza also creates jewelry, sculpture, glass work, two-dimensional art, and large-scale installations. His designs are clean and striking, and he uses a Northern variation of Northwest Coast art, with a contemporary graphic art twist. His apparel hit the international scene two years ago when he designed the uniforms for the Netherlands team for the 2010 Winter Olympics held in BC. Edzerza is currently based out of Vancouver, where he operates his art gallery.

name: Blushing Larks Earrings
description: These earrings were designed by Wayne Nez Gaussoin (Navajo/Picuris Pueblo). These round bangle earrings are part of a new popular series by the artist. The red glass is reminiscent of birds sitting in a sterling silver hoop. The sterling has a drilled texture with a high polish black patina on the outside and a high polish silver on the inside. Custom options are available for the patina to be revised to the inside, or requests for any detail change, or specific size or length. This item ships from the US.

name: Summer Flower Bracelet
description: This hand-fabricated bracelet was made by award-winning artist David Gaussoin. It features Tufa cast Sterling silver, stainless steel wire, and red glass. It measures 5" x 5" x 3". David Gaussoin comes from a long line of artists, including silversmiths, painters, rug weavers, sculptors, and wood workers. He creates wearable art for the body with gold, silver, and precious and semiprecious stones, as well as unconventional materials, such as steel and aluminum. This item ships from the US. For the Beyond Buckskin Boutique, Gaussoin brings us a 'high street' collection of jewelry cut from diamond plated aluminum. Diamond plate is often used on stairs and catwalks in industrial settings (the added texture reduces the risk of slipping), but it is also used on the interior of ambulances and on the sides of firetrucks. While Gaussoin references the street, his couture pieces are clearly high fashion and high quality. Price of shipping and handling included.

name: Metallic Pleated Top
description: This hand-pleated top was made by Navajo fashion designer Consuelo Pascual using soft linen in gunmetal grey and features metallic threads in the fabric. The collar is attached to the bodice and clasps in the back with hooks and eyes, and the bodice closes with a separating zipper. Bust 34.5", Waist 26.5". This item ships from the US. Pascual's designs for sale on the Beyond Buckskin Boutique are chic futuristic dresses - influenced by the blackness of outer space, the glimmer of stars, and the architecture of a fluid space ship. Working with a palette of mostly black, silver, and grey, her work is meticulously constructed. She also plays with fabric texture, and her latest pieces feature variations of pleats - the intricate detailing of which is time consuming yet stunning. The designs formed by pleating has Pascual creating varying silhouettes, and this, combined with her space cadet aesthetic, creates an exciting new path for Native fashion.

name: Blessings
description: These cool earrings come from the creative hands of MaRia A. Bird (Navajo/Hopi/Santa Clara Pueblo), the owner of Mea B'fly Designs, and feature a unique tulip-shaped design. Each graphic print is made by Mea, starting with a focal background photograph that she elaborates with other design elements. The graphic prints are then adhered to a balsa wood piece and topped off with surgical steel earring hooks and jump rings. They are bright with vivid color patterns, lightweight for a comfortable wear, and glossy with a slick overcoat to protect the design. Mea B'Fly earrings are a great fusion of the powerful past with the energy of today. This item ships from the US.

artists.name: MaRia Bird (Navajo / Hopi / Santa Clara Pueblo)

name: Fire Colored Beaded Bracelet
description:
This beaded bracelet was created by Dominique Tsinnie using size 13/0 charlotte true cut beads in shades of red, maroon, orange, yellow, white, and black.

The Peyote Stitch pattern is beaded on both sides of the bracelet. The bracelet is designed to be worn like any other bracelet with the notion that the customer are careful not to bend the bracelet excessively or it may damage the thread that keeps the beads together. The one-of-a-kind beaded bracelet measures 1.5" wide and 6" long.

Price of shipping and handling included.

name: DAWA (Hopi Sun Face) Earrings
description:
These cool earrings come from the creative hands of MaRia A. Bird (Navajo/Hopi/Santa Clara Pueblo), the owner of Mea B'fly Designs, and feature a Hopi Sun Face design on round earrings. Each graphic print is made by Mea, starting with a focal background photograph that she elaborates with other design elements. The graphic prints are then adhered to a balsa wood piece and topped off with surgical steel earring hooks and jump rings. They are bright with vivid color patterns, lightweight for a comfortable wear, and glossy with a slick overcoat to protect the design. Mea B'Fly earrings are a great fusion of the powerful past with the energy of today. This item ships from the US.

Bird comes from a small community on the western edge of the Navajo Nation and northern edge of the Hopi reservation. Bird stated, "My creation and traditional upbringing began on the geographical border of my identity - Dine' and Hopi - ironically but luckily. Twenty something years later here I am a proud Native American woman, strong, married, instictivly motherly, humbly spoken, humanly hearted, creatively skilled, and infinitely linked to the roots of Mother Earth."

artists.name: MaRia Bird (Navajo / Hopi / Santa Clara Pueblo)

name: Show Me How to Live
description:
These earrings are designed and hand-beaded by Navajo artist Andrea Preston. Each are delicately made with 21 different colored Size 11 seed beads and trimmed from the inside out in black satin matte beads. This pair measures at 2.5 x 2 inches, and makes for the perfect dangled ear accessory. All beaded earrings are finished with sterling silver earring hooks and hardware. This item ships from the US.

Preston's jewelry is a fusion of bright colors, geometric designs and powwow aesthetics. Silver and gold metallic accents and a sense of cool '80s inspiration give her earrings a fresh urban feel. This pair is elegantly and perfectly constructed, with straight lines and precisely placed beads. With 21 colors and a black base, these earrings will stand out and match all your favorite outfits. Shipping & handling included.

name: Quilled Star Medallion
description:
This four-row quilled medallion was created by Lonna Jackson (Spirit Lake Dakota / Turtle Mountain Chippewa). The artist plucks the quills, cleans them, then dyes them before beginning the process of wrapping them to create the medallion. 

Traditionally, Native American people wore medallions for spiritual and physical protection. This medallion boasts four rows of quillwork in black, blue and fire colors. The pendant measures 4" in diameter and hangs on a 27" white buckskin lace. A central star along with brass beads and fringe accent this show-stopper. This item ships from the US.

Porcupine quillwork is an art form that is unique to North America, and Native people of this continent used quills as an important decorative technique before the introduction of glass beads. Though beadwork blossomed as a significant artistic medium for Native people, several groups and individuals maintain the age-old traditional practice of quillwork.

artists.name: Lonna Jackson (Spirit Lake Dakota / Turtle Mountain Chippewa)

name: Extra Large Quill Hoop Earrings (More Colors)
description:
These beautiful earrings were skillfully created by Lonna Jackson (Spirit Lake Dakota / Turtle Mountain Chippewa). The artist plucks the quills, cleans them, then dyes them before beginning the process of wrapping them to create the vibrant earrings.

Porcupine quillwork is an art form that is unique to North America, and Native people of this continent used quills as an important decorative technique before the introduction of glass beads. Though beadwork blossomed as a significant artistic medium for Native people, several groups and individuals maintain the age-old traditional practice of quillwork. 

These super lightweight earrings feature a colorful fully quilled hoop and measure over 2.5" in diameter and hang 3.5" from the ear. Select your color option below. Whether it's a gift for yourself or for someone special in your life, these earrings come packaged in a jewelry box with ribbon. This item ships from the US.

artists.name: Lonna Jackson (Spirit Lake Dakota / Turtle Mountain Chippewa)

name: Beaded Porcupine Quill Earrings (Orange and Gold)
description: These beautiful diamond-shaped earrings were made by Inuit artist Caroline Blechert. They feature natural porcupine quills alongside perfect delica beads in bright orange and glimmering gold. The diamond shaped earrings measure 2.5" x 1.25". This item ships from Canada. Blechert uses porcupine quills in such modern and striking ways that her collections are both memorable and enchanting. She is Inuvialuit, and was born and raised in Yellowknife - a community located in the Northwest Territories of Canada, and this influence of the far north environment is evident in her work.

name: Paul Frank x Autumn Dawn Gomez Seaside Sunset Collection
description: SALE: For a limited time, take $20 off the Seaside Sunset pendant necklace! Regularly priced $50. Limited quantities. This exciting collection presents a collaboration between Paul Frank and four Native American designers. Each of these designers present a unique style, informed and shaped by their relationships to their different tribes, communities, cultures and identities. This partnership allowed for this group of artists to share Native American historical legacies of creativity and tradition, while also blending the fun and colorful aesthetic that is Paul Frank. The “Paul Frank Presents” fashion collection includes this jewelry set by Taos Pueblo and Comanche artist Autumn Dawn Gomez. She explained, “Seeing that Julius has experienced so many different kinds of lives and been all around the world many times, I tried to capture his most beautiful memories of nature and beyond. I wanted to capture what he saw on his adventures, including what is represented in this collection: a California Beach at sunset." The collections feature the silhouette head of Julius the monkey in a Hama bead crown, necklace, and cuff, and give a nod to traditional concepts about the environment and beadwork while incorporating the playful energy of the Paul Frank company and color palette. The items are part of a limited edition capsule collection, and are hand-produced in small quantities by the artist. Click here to learn more about Autumn and to shop directly from the artist. Click here to shop other great styles on BBB from Autumn and The Soft Museum!

artists.name: Autumn Dawn Gomez (Comanche / Taos) for The Soft Museum

name: Decolonize Box Logo Hoodie
description:
This limited edition hoodie was designed by Jarrett Martineau (Cree/Dene) and features an embroidered red and white "Decolonize" box logo on a 100% Cotton hooded sweatshirt. Unisex Sizing (S-XXL). 

The hoodie is part of a Decolonizing Media project to help disseminate decolonial ideas through visuals and media. Martineau is a Cree/Dene digital media producer & hip-hop artist from Frog Lake First Nation, Alberta.

name: Diné Bizaad Black Bandana
description:
These cool silkscreened bandanas feature an intricate and original design by Navajo artist David Sloan. Images are paired with their name in the Navajo language - so you can learn the Navajo words for things like bicycle, butterfly, helicopter, and penguin. 

Sloan states, "I hope my art conveys a sense of pride in learning Navajo or any new language and culture. I hope it encourages other people to learn some non-mainstream language also. I hope it conveys an importance to take care of the planet, environment, and our fellow creatures. I feel fortunate to use my imagination to create art."

The bandanas are 100% cotton and measure 20" x 20". Wear as a bandana on your head, neck, arm, or leg, or frame it and hang on your wall as fresh Native street art. This item ships from the US.

name: Single Mini Feather Fantasy Earrings
description: These adorable mini feather earrings are the kid sisters to the larger 8-Bit Feather Fantasy Earrings by The Soft Museum. They will quickly become your favorite 'go to' pair of everyday casual earrings because they are super-lightweight and pack a lot of punch. The pixelated earrings are available in various color options. They are 100% handmade using only premium mini-Hama beads - tiny plastic beads that are fused together upon heating. The feathers measure 1.75", and hang 2.75" in total length from the ear. This item ships from the US.

artists.name: Autumn Dawn Gomez (Comanche / Taos) for The Soft Museum

name: Pink Abalone Rounds
description:
These earrings were made by Hupa/Tolowa jewelry artist Pamela Mattz. They feature beautiful round abalone shell discs hanging on sterling silver hooks. The earrings hang 1.75" long, and the discs measure 1.25" diameter. Each shell has a unique personality, and the patterns on the discs, while all reflect beautiful pinks and greens, will differ slightly from shell to shell, and from earring to earring.

Mattz's jewelry is inspired by age-old Pacific Northwest California Native American adornment traditions.

name: Pathways: Earthen"wear" Earrings - The Yellow Collection
description: These handmade micaceous clay earrings were created by Courtney M. Leonard (Shinnecock Nation). The earrings are a part of her "Pathways" design series. Each piece is unique, one-of-a-kind, and handmade. Designs may be replicated but will never be exactly the same, much like the paths we take in life. Leonard views jewelry as an extension of our bodies and our minds, and the patterns on the discs reflect magnified aspects of our stamped records of time. Each recalls history and our cultural landscape. The earrings measure 1.5" in diameter and hang on 14k gold plated findings. The Diamond earrings are a Handmade Porcelain Clay Set with Yellow Titanium Findings. Interested in ideas of jewelry as human architecture, Leonard is an artist and filmmaker whose work explores the evolution of language, image and culture through various media including video, audio, and tangible objects. She currently lives in Santa Fe, New Mexico and works as a professional artist, lecturer, and Adjunct Faculty at the Institute of American Indian Arts. This item ships from the US.

name: Gelato Flux Ring
description: This ring was designed by Wayne Nez Gaussoin (Navajo/Picuris Pueblo). "Just a dob..please." This is truely a unique and one of a kind two finger ring. It is made using sterling silver and hand-poured rubber. This is a very playful and fun accessory. This item ships from the US.

name: Humma Bird Earrings
description:
These round earrings come from the creative hands of MaRia A. Bird, (Navajo/Hopi/Santa Clara Pueblo) the owner of Mea B'fly Designs. The earrings come in three options: Small Dangle (1.25" circles), Medium (2" circles) and Large (2.5" circles). The name of her small business is a combination of Mea, a childhood nickname short for MaRia, and B'fly, short for butterfly "in honor of my late great grandmother and giver of all that is special and cherished by me - family and self."

Each graphic print is made by Bird, starting with a focal background image that she elaborates with other design elements. 'Humma Bird' is an original drawing by Bird. The graphic prints are then adhered to a stained balsa wood piece and topped off with surgical steel earring hooks and jump rings. They are bright with vivid color patterns, lightweight for a comfortable wear, and glossy with a slick overcoat to protect the design. Mea B'Fly earrings are a great fusion of the powerful past with the energy of today.

artists.name: MaRia Bird (Navajo / Hopi / Santa Clara Pueblo)

name: Beaded Porcupine Quill Earrings (Lime and Gold)
description: These beautiful diamond-shaped earrings were made by Inuit artist Caroline Blechert. They feature natural porcupine quills alongside perfect delica beads in lime green and 24 kt gold finish. The diamond shaped earrings measure 2.75" x 1.5". This item ships from Canada. Blechert uses porcupine quills in such modern and striking ways that her collections are both memorable and enchanting. She is Inuvialuit, and was born and raised in Yellowknife - a community located in the Northwest Territories of Canada, and this influence of the far north environment is evident in her work.

name: Morning Glory Earrings
description: These earrings come from the creative hands of MaRia A. Bird (Navajo/Hopi/Santa Clara Pueblo), the owner of Mea B'fly Designs. Each graphic print is made by Bird, starting with a focal background image that she elaborates with other design elements. The graphic prints are then adhered to a balsa wood piece and topped off with surgical steel earring hooks and jump rings. They are bright with vivid color patterns, lightweight for a comfortable wear, and glossy with a slick overcoat to protect the design. Mea B'Fly earrings are a great fusion of the powerful past with the energy of today. This item ships from the US.

artists.name: MaRia Bird (Navajo / Hopi / Santa Clara Pueblo)

name: Quiver Purse
description: This Quiver Purse was made by Sun Rose Iron Shell (Sicangu/Oglala Lakota) for her company, Warrior Status. It is inspired by traditional Northern Plains parfleche with a contemporary flare. It is made with all Natural Elk Rawhide, Sugar Skull beads, African Batiked bone discs and chunky Savorski crystal. It is finished off with velvet and silk fabric containing beadwork strips, a 7 inch zipper and small secondary handle. The Quiver Purse was also featured in this year's Santa Fe New Mexican Indian Market Magazine fashion edition editorial. The shoulder handle length is 18", and the purse measures 10 inches long and 4 inches wide. Comes with storage box and care instructions.  This item ships from the US.

artists.name: Sun Rose Iron Shell (Sicangu / Oglala Lakota)

name: Natural Sea Monster Tunic Dress
description:
This item was selected by Presence 4.0 style blogger and fashionista Chelsea Chee as an item to feature in our new P4xBBB collaboration project. Click here to read more and to see how Chelsea styles this cool tunic with the Loksi wrap bracelet and her moccasins.
This Natural Sea Monster tunic dress was designed by Tahltan artist Alano Edzerza. It features a sleek and bold all-over 'Sea Monster' design that has been silk-screened onto a stylish black tunic dress. The fabric is 100% Fine Jersey cotton construction. The medium sized tunic is approximately 33" in total length. The tunic is loose-fitting on top, snug around bottom, and has raw edges.

name: Chunky Abalone and Clear Glass Choker
description:
This necklace was made by Hupa/Tolowa jewelry artist Pamela Mattz. It features chunky clear glass beads alongside iridescent abalone round shells. The choker necklace measures 18" and features sterling silver hardwear. Each shell has a unique personality, and the patterns on the discs, while all reflect beautiful pinks and greens, will differ slightly from shell to shell.

Mattz's jewelry is inspired by age-old Pacific Northwest California Native American adornment traditions. This item ships from the US.

name: Patterns Tee
description: This tee was designed by Navajo artist Jared Yazzie for his company OxDx. OxDx features designs that depict American Indian struggles, issues, and art. OxDx is strongly influenced by Native culture, street art, and music. This item ships from the US. The design is printed onto the front of an extremely comfortable and lightweight 100% Polyester T-shirt, made of a fine count yarn. Unisex size – women may prefer to order one size smaller. See Size Chart.

name: American Horse Earrings
description: These earrings come from the creative hands of MaRia A. Bird (Navajo/Hopi/Santa Clara Pueblo), the owner of Mea B'fly Designs. Each graphic print is made by Bird, starting with a focal background image that she elaborates with other design elements. The graphic prints are then adhered to a balsa wood piece and topped off with surgical steel earring hooks and jump rings. They are bright with vivid color patterns, lightweight for a comfortable wear, and glossy with a slick overcoat to protect the design. Mea B'Fly earrings are a great fusion of the powerful past with the energy of today. This item ships from the US.

artists.name: MaRia Bird (Navajo / Hopi / Santa Clara Pueblo)

name: Sapphire Wing Ring
description: These pretty sapphire wing rings were designed by Chickasaw metalsmith Kristen Dorsey. Like a bird stretching out its wing, the Sapphire Wing Ring gracefully arches over the finger and is adorned with a 2.5mm Sapphire. Available in sizes 5, 6, 7, and 8. Available in natural sapphire colors: blue, light green, orange, lavender, gold. Price of US shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Moon Rise Belt Buckle
description: This belt buckle was designed by Wayne Nez Gaussoin (Navajo/Picuris Pueblo). This rustic buckle is reminiscent of sitting on a moonlit hillside watching the Moon Rise over the horizon. It features sterling, snowflake obsidian, a black patina and a light roll print added. Dimensions: 4"L x 2"H. This item ships from the US.

name: Pueblo Tracks Belt Buckle
description: This belt buckle was designed by Wayne Nez Gaussoin (Navajo/Picuris Pueblo). This rustic buckle is reminiscent of tire tracks in the dirt roads on the reservation during the winter. It features sterling Silver with a high polish black patina and sealed rust accent marks created using a light roll print pattern. Dimensions: 4"L x 2"H. This item ships from the US.

name: Double Navajo Button Earrings
description: These earrings were designed by Wayne Nez Gaussoin (Navajo/Picuris Pueblo). These "Double Navajo Button" earrings are handcrafted out of sterling silver and including the earring wire. They are lightweight and can be worn with both dressy or casual styles. These pair have the same texture on opposite sides. They measure about 4 inches in length. These earrings were shaped using a traditional handmade die form. This shape can be found on Navajo (Dine) moccasins, men's and women's shirts. Gaussoin's contemporary interpretation of the traditional look creates an open free flowing feel. This item ships from the US.

name: Haudenosaunee Shades
description: These cool sunglasses are designed by Tammy Beauvais. On each side of the shades is a small silver detail representation of the "Hiawatha Belt": a wampum belt symbolizing the peace agreement between five of the nations and the founding of the Iroquois Confederacy. This item ships from Canada. Beauvais opened her first fashion design company, Tammy Beauvais Designs, in Kahnawake, Quebec in January 1999. Her work has been greatly influenced by her families connection to the Longhouse, where traditional ways of life, customs and culture have never been broken.

name: Beaded Stunner Sunglasses
description: These beaded sunglasses were made by Cree/Metis artist Candace Halcro. They feature stunner style black plastic frames that have been hand-beaded using multicolored seed beads in various hues. Each pair is one of a kind. Superior quality in both the frames and the beads, the patterns are straight and vibrant with colorful combinations. Held to the frames by contact cement, the glass beads will not come loose with regular wear. Custom orders are available upon request at an increased price. One size.

name: $100 Gift Certificate
description: Let them choose the gift they want with a Beyond Buckskin gift certificate! Beyond Buckskin has an incredible selection of Native-made items, but sometimes you just can’t find the right gift for that special someone. Whether it’s a birthday present, graduation gift, employee reward, a gift to celebrate a special occasion, or a simple gesture of appreciation, a Beyond Buckskin Boutique Gift Certificate is the perfect present. name: $25 Gift Certificate
description: Let them choose the gift they want with a Beyond Buckskin gift certificate! Beyond Buckskin has an incredible selection of Native-made items, but sometimes you just can’t find the right gift for that special someone. Whether it’s a birthday present, graduation gift, employee reward, a gift to celebrate a special occasion, or a simple gesture of appreciation, a Beyond Buckskin Boutique Gift Certificate is the perfect present. BBB Gift Certificates are redeemable toward hundreds of items at Beyond Buckskin, have no fees, and expire one year from issue date. We are always adding new items to the Boutique, so gift certificates allow your recipient to choose from our growing selection. Three delivery options: Via Email: Buy now, and a Gift Certificate with a specialized promo code will be emailed to you or the recipient within 24 hours (or once the transaction clears). If emailed to you, the gift certificate can then be forwarded to the recipient or printed out to give. Via Mail: A physical gift certificate will be mailed to either you or the recipient. With Greeting Card: For an additional $4, physical gift certificates will be sent with a Butterfly Heart greeting card by Jamie Gentry, perfect for any gifting occasion. Contact us if you have any specific requests.

name: Square Buckle
description: This hand-fabricated belt buckle was made with diamond metal plate aluminum by award-winning artist David Gaussoin. David Gaussoin comes from a long line of artists, including silversmiths, painters, rug weavers, sculptors, and wood workers. He creates wearable art for the body with gold, silver, and precious and semiprecious stones, as well as unconventional materials, such as steel and aluminum. This item ships from the US. For the Beyond Buckskin Boutique, Gaussoin brings us a 'high street' collection of jewelry cut from diamond plated aluminum. Diamond plate is often used on stairs and catwalks in industrial settings (the added texture reduces the risk of slipping), but it is also used on the interior of ambulances and on the sides of firetrucks. While Gaussoin references the street, his couture pieces are clearly high fashion and high quality. This buckle measures 3" x 2" and fits a 1.5" wide belt. Shipping and handling included.

name: Silver Metallic Dress
description: This dress was designed by Navajo fashion designer Consuelo Pascual and is made of light silver metallic cotton. It features hand-pleated detailing on the front. It has hand-ruched detailing made of chiffon that features a metallic silver circle print. This dress is a size 4/6 and measures Bust: 34.5, Waist: 26.5, Hip: 36.5 and Neck band: 13.5". Pascual's designs for sale on the Beyond Buckskin Boutique are chic futuristic dresses - influenced by the blackness of outer space, the glimmer of stars, and the architecture of a fluid space ship. Working with a palette of mostly black, silver, and grey, her work is meticulously constructed. She also plays with fabric texture, and her latest pieces feature variations of pleats - the intricate detailing of which is time consuming yet stunning. The designs formed by pleating has Pascual creating varying silhouettes, and this, combined with her space cadet aesthetic, creates an exciting new path for Native fashion. All jewelry worn by the model was also made by Pascual and will be for sale at a later date.

name: Turquoise Sea Monster Tunic Dress
description: This turquoise Sea Monster tunic dress was designed by Tahltan artist Alano Edzerza. It features a sleek and bold all-over 'Sea Monster' design that has been silk-screened onto a stylish turquoise tunic dress. The fabric is 100% Fine Jersey cotton construction. The medium sized tunic is approximately 33" in total length. The tunic is loose-fitting on top, snug around bottom, and has raw edges. A rising star in the fashion world, Edzerza also creates jewelry, sculpture, glass work, two-dimensional art, and large-scale installations. His designs are clean and striking, and he uses a Northern variation of Northwest Coast art, with a contemporary graphic art twist. His apparel hit the international scene two years ago when he designed the uniforms for the Netherlands team for the 2010 Winter Olympics held in BC. Edzerza is currently based out of Vancouver, where he operates his art gallery.

name: Pathways: Earthen"wear" Earrings - The Blue Collection
description: These handmade micaceous clay earrings were created by Courtney M. Leonard (Shinnecock Nation). The earrings are a part of her "Pathways" design series. Each piece is unique, one-of-a-kind, and handmade. Designs may be replicated but will never be exactly the same, much like the paths we take in life. Leonard views jewelry as an extension of our bodies and our minds, and the patterns on the discs reflect magnified aspects of our stamped records of time. Each recalls history and our cultural landscape. The earrings measure 1.5" in diameter and hang on sterling silver findings. Interested in ideas of jewelry as human architecture, Leonard is an artist and filmmaker whose work explores the evolution of language, image and culture through various media including video, audio, and tangible objects. She currently lives in Santa Fe, New Mexico and works as a professional artist, lecturer, and Adjunct Faculty at the Institute of American Indian Arts.

name: Love In Everything Baby Booties
description: These cute lil booties were made by designer Jamie Gentry (Kwakwaka'wakw), a mother of three boys and the brains behind the upcycled children's clothing company, Love In Everything. Each pair of booties is made from recycled leather, usually leather from jackets or clothing found at a thrift shop. The use of recycled leather means the material is broken in, and the super soft leather is ideal for delicate baby feet. These booties fit as a size 0-6 months, and measure 4 inches long and 2.5 inches wide with elastic in the ankles to help keep booties on. This item ships from the US.

name: VO Signature Handbag (Black)
description:
The chic VO Signature Handbag was designed by Virgil Ortiz and bears his signature marks: the Water, Sun, and Wild Spinach designs are just some of the unique and symbolic elements that create the high demand for Ortiz's pieces.

Heavily sought out by celebrities, royalty, rock stars, and collectors alike, supernova Native artist Virgil Ortiz is taking Native fashion to the next level. He is an award-winning designer and comes from a family of well-known traditional Native American potters. His designs are a captivating balance between the provocative, edgy, and traditional.

FOR A LIMITED TIME: FREE scarf with each purchase of the VO Signature Purse. (Please indicate which free scarf you would like upon checkout).

Free shipping in the USA only.

name: Paul Frank x Autumn Dawn Gomez Meadow Morning Collection
description: SALE: For a limited time, take $20 off the Meadow Morning pendant necklace! Regularly priced $50. Limited quantities. This exciting collection presents a collaboration between Paul Frank and four Native American designers. Each of these designers present a unique style, informed and shaped by their relationships to their different tribes, communities, cultures and identities. This partnership allowed for this group of artists to share Native American historical legacies of creativity and tradition, while also blending the fun and colorful aesthetic that is Paul Frank. The “Paul Frank Presents” fashion collection includes these jewelry sets by Taos Pueblo and Comanche artist Autumn Dawn Gomez. She explained, "For this project, I created Hama Bead jewelry using a bold and neon palette combined with strong elements of geometry to create 5 different nature scenes - each captured in the silhouette of Paul Frank’s mascot, Julius. The result suggests neon video game backgrounds from the early ‘90s paired with the bold geometry of Southern Plains beadwork." The items are part of a limited edition capsule collection, and are hand-produced in small quantities by the artist. Click here to learn more about Autumn and to shop directly from the artist. Click here to shop other great styles on BBB from Autumn and The Soft Museum!

artists.name: Autumn Dawn Gomez (Comanche / Taos) for The Soft Museum

name: The Arrival
description: These earrings come from the creative hands of MaRia A. Bird (Navajo/Hopi/Santa Clara Pueblo), the owner of Mea B'fly Designs. Each graphic print is made by Bird, starting with a focal background image that she elaborates with other design elements. The graphic prints are then adhered to a balsa wood piece and topped off with surgical steel earring hooks and jump rings. They are bright with vivid color patterns, lightweight for a comfortable wear, and glossy with a slick overcoat to protect the design. Mea B'Fly earrings are an electrifying fusion of the powerful past with the energy of today. This item ships from the US.

artists.name: MaRia Bird (Navajo / Hopi / Santa Clara Pueblo)

name: Paul Frank x Autumn Dawn Gomez Desert Night Collection
description: SALE: For a limited time, take $20 off the Desert Night pendant necklace! Regularly priced $50. Limited quantities. This exciting collection presents a collaboration between Paul Frank and four Native American designers. Each of these designers present a unique style, informed and shaped by their relationships to their different tribes, communities, cultures and identities. This partnership allowed for this group of artists to share Native American historical legacies of creativity and tradition, while also blending the fun and colorful aesthetic that is Paul Frank. The “Paul Frank Presents” fashion collection includes these jewelry sets by Taos Pueblo and Comanche artist Autumn Dawn Gomez. She explained, "My grandmothers taught me how to bead and I have the honor of owning beautiful vintage pieces made by my grandmother’s aunts. I remember visiting in Oklahoma as a little girl and seeing their beads and supplies all spread out over the kitchen table. Though Hama Beads are not a traditional medium, I feel like I am part of their creative legacy and I look to those memories for inspiration." The collections feature the silhouette head of Julius the monkey in a Hama bead crown, 36" chain necklace, and PF initials cuff, and reference traditional concepts about the environment and beadwork while incorporating the playful energy of the Paul Frank company and color palette. The items are part of a limited edition capsule collection, and are hand-produced in small quantities by the artist. Click here to learn more about Autumn and to shop directly from the artist. Click here to shop other great styles on BBB from Autumn and The Soft Museum!

artists.name: Autumn Dawn Gomez (Comanche / Taos) for The Soft Museum

name: Get Back In Your Box
description: This one-of-a-kind bracelet was created using sterling silver, copper, turquoise around a 'Indian' (in a box) by award-winning artist David Gaussoin. Gaussoin comes from a long line of artists, including silversmiths, painters, rug weavers, sculptors, and wood workers. He creates wearable art for the body with gold, sterling silver, and various precious and semiprecious stones, as well as materials not necessarily associated with jewelry, such as steel and aluminum. The bracelet measures 5" x 2.5" x 3". Shipping and handling included.

name: Spike Shearling Cuff
description: This cuff was made by award-winning artist Jamie Okuma (Luiseño/Shoshone Bannock). Okuma began working with beads as a child creating her own dance regalia for powwows near her home, on the La Jolla Luiseño Reservation. Historical accuracy, exemplary workmanship, and keen attention to detail are the hallmarks of her work. At the age of 22, Okuma became the youngest artist in the history of Santa Fe Indian Market to win Best of Show, which would become the first of her five Best in Show awards: three from SWAIA and two from the Heard Museum Indian Fair and Market. She is now venturing into the exciting world of contemporary fashion. Price of shipping and handling included. This item ships from the US.

name: Blue and Green Beaded Bracelet
description:
This blue and green beaded bracelet was created by Dominique Tsinnie using size 13/0 charlotte true cut beads in shades of blue, green, white, black, and pearl white.

The Peyote Stitch pattern is beaded on both sides of the bracelet. The bracelet is designed to be worn like any other bracelet with the notion that the customer are careful not to bend the bracelet excessively or it may damage the thread that keeps the beads together. The one-of-a-kind beaded bracelet measures 1.5" wide and 6" long.

Price of shipping and handling included.

name: Two in One Necklace
description:
This striking necklace was made by Hupa/Tolowa jewelry artist Pamela Mattz. It features a long handmade necklace of abalone nuggets, sterling silver, and shimmering iridescent faceted glass beads. It can be worn as a long single-strand necklace, or it can be doubled up and wear as a two-strand necklace.

The necklace measures 45" long. Each shell has a unique personality, and the patterns on the discs, while all reflect beautiful pinks, greens and blues, will differ slightly from shell to shell, and from necklace to necklace. This item ships from the US.

Mattz's jewelry is inspired by age-old Pacific Northwest California Native American adornment traditions.

name: Loksi Talowa Haksibish Taka'li
description: These one-of-a-kind earrings are titled Loksi Talowa Haksibish Taka'li. They were made by Chickasaw metalsmith artist Kristen Dorsey. Loksi (turtle) is a central aspect of the Stomp Dance. Shells are filled with pebbles and bound together on leather. Women then wear them on their legs as they dance, creating the rhythm of the music. These earrings are composed of individual repoussé and chased turtle shells crafted from Copper, Fine Silver, and Fine Silver with 24K Kumbo fused to the surface. They hang from Mexican Fire Opals, representing the sacred fire, which is central to the Stomp Dance ground. These earrings are fabricated out of 14k yellow gold, 24k gold kumboo, fine silver, copper, and AAA grade Mexican fire opal. The earrings measure 2.5"x 1.5." This item ships from the US. Price of US shipping and handling included. Expedited 2-3 day shipping available for an additional $25, see drop-down menu.

name: Cedar Bracelet with Abalone
description: This bracelet was made by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. It features red cedar bark that has been finely woven into a bracelet. It is accented with a unique abalone shell and measures 8" x 1". O’Brien weaves baskets, hats and jewelry with red and yellow cedar bark using twining and plaiting forms of weaving. Cedar bark weaving has been part of the culture of the peoples of the Northwest Coast for thousands of years; it was and continues to be an integral part of the culture. The process is deeply spiritual: beginning with an offering of tobacco to give thanks to the tree for its offering, O’Brien then strips, soaks, and prepares the bark to be woven. It is a way to carry on the traditional ways of her ancestors, and share this medicine with the world. The pricing of her art is based on the amount of time spent harvesting the bark, preparation and weaving time, finish and type of weave.

name: Flower Power Earrings
description:
These earrings were made by Hupa/Tolowa jewelry artist Pamela Mattz. They feature beautiful teardrop shaped abalone shells hanging on sterling silver hooks. A dropdown flower dangles from the bottom of each earring. 

The earrings hang 2.5" long, and measure .5" width. Each shell has a unique personality, and the patterns on the discs, while all reflect beautiful pinks and greens, will differ slightly from shell to shell, and from earring to earring.

Mattz's jewelry is inspired by age-old Pacific Northwest California Native American adornment traditions. This item ships from the US.

name: Ceci N'est Pas Un Conciliateur
description: This tee was designed by Navajo artist Dustin Martin for his company S.O.L.O. (Sovereign Original Land Owners). "Ceci n'est pas un conciliateur." TRANSLATION: "This is not a peacemaker." The "New Model Army Metallic Cartridge Revolving Pistol" was adopted as the standard military service revolver from 1873-1892. Nicknamed the "Peacemaker", Samuel Colt's revolutionary side arm was used by Colonel George Armstrong Custer's 7th Cavalry during The Great Sioux War of 1876. Custer and 267 of his men were killed when they engaged a combined force of Lakota, Northern Cheyenne, and Arapaho warriors desperate to protect their families camped along the Little Bighorn River on June 25th. Led by the likes of Crazy Horse and Chief Gall, these sovereign original land owners understood that the implement on Custer's hip meant anything but peace. RESIST THE HYPE. Details: Super Soft Natural color tee with black print. 100% combed cotton. Jersey kit. Tear-Away Tag. Slim fit. Printed in the USA. Price of shipping and handling included. NEW: Want a more fitted tee? Now available in Women's Crew Neck "Fashion Fit" tee. Heather Grey. 50% Polyester, 25% Cotton, 25% Rayon. See dropdown menu to order. This item ships from the US.

name: 5th Avenue
description: This cool purse was made using faux crocodile leather and sterling silver by award-winning artist David Gaussoin. David Gaussoin comes from a long line of artists, including silversmiths, painters, rug weavers, sculptors, and wood workers. He creates wearable art for the body with gold, silver, and precious and semiprecious stones, as well as unconventional materials, such as steel and aluminum. The purse measures 2.5" x 6" x 3". Shipping and handling included.

name: Charcoal Fringe Baby Booties
description: These cute lil booties were made by designer Jamie Gentry (Kwakwaka'wakw), a mother of three boys and the brains behind the upcycled children's clothing company, Love In Everything. Each pair of booties is made from recycled leather, usually leather from jackets or clothing found at a thrift shop. The use of recycled leather means the material is broken in, and the super soft leather is ideal for delicate baby feet. These plush and sweet booties measure 4 inches long and 2.5 inches wide with elastic in the ankles to help keep booties on. This item ships from the US.

name: Whirling Logs Tee
description: This tee was designed by Navajo artist Dustin Martin for his company SOLO (Sovereign Original Land Owners). Navajo creation stories tell The People that their ancestors crossed a large and treacherous river before reaching dinébikéyah (Navajo Land) in the fourth world. At least one hataathli (Navajo religious singer) told white scholars in the late 1800’s that “people who cut their hair square in the front” taught these travelers how to assemble a raft anointed enough to get them across safely. The vessel was constructed from a bough of each of the four trees represented on the shirt (Top Right Clockwise: Juniper, Ponderosa Pine, Gambel Oak, Piñon Pine). Eventually, their brave journey across the river set motion to these “whirling logs”. Traditionally, a wheel of right angles is used to depict this important vehicle to Navajo history. Unfortunately, the Nazi party adopted an uncannily similar image as the badge of their war machine in the 1930’s. This design attempts to reclaim the symbol through revision and abstraction. More importantly, however, it is a means for reinvigorating the oral history that inspired the image in the first place. Details: White/Black Tee made with 100% combed cotton. Jersey knit. Tear-Away Tag. Printed in the USA. Athletic Fit/ Unisex. This item ships from the US.

name: Pathways: Earthen"wear" Earrings - The Purple Collection
description: These handmade micaceous clay earrings were created by Courtney M. Leonard (Shinnecock Nation). The earrings are a part of her "Pathways" design series. Each piece is unique, one-of-a-kind, and handmade. Designs may be replicated but will never be exactly the same, much like the paths we take in life. Leonard views jewelry as an extension of our bodies and our minds, and the patterns on the discs reflect magnified aspects of our stamped records of time. Each recalls history and our cultural landscape. The earrings measure 1.5" in diameter and hang on sterling silver findings. Interested in ideas of jewelry as human architecture, Leonard is an artist and filmmaker whose work explores the evolution of language, image and culture through various media including video, audio, and tangible objects. She currently lives in Santa Fe, New Mexico and works as a professional artist, lecturer, and Adjunct Faculty at the Institute of American Indian Arts.

name: Purples Wonder Bracelet
description: This tulip-shaped cuff bracelet was designed by Navajo artist JT Willie. It features a tulip beaded with size 13 charlotte cut beads in purple hues on sterling silver oxidized for old style finish. The tulip is edged with sparkling Swarovski crystals and measures 3'' by 2 1/2''. The cuff is 2'' wide and is adjustable. It fits an average size 5-6 wrist. This item ships from the US. Originally from Twin Lakes, New Mexico, Willie started beading as a teenager, learning techniques from his family, beaders, steamstress, and silversmiths. At the age of 16, he learned the style of beadwork from the Kiowa and Comanche Tribes of Oklahoma. He researches different styles of beadwork and incorporates them into his own unique style.

name: Better Recognize Tee
description: This tee was designed by Navajo artist Dustin Martin for his company SOLO (Sovereign Original Land Owners). The Seal of New York City officially recognizes 1625 as The Big Apple’s “founding” date. Yet European explorers offer accounts of the area’s Indigenous residents a century prior. Sent by Francis I to find the and navigate the mythical northwest passage for France, the Florentine Giovanni da Verrazano sailed into New York Harbor in 1524. He was greeted by flotillas of Indigenous onlookers. S.O.L.O. hopes that our alterations to a symbol of imperial establishment implore viewers/buyers/wearers to look beyond dominant depictions of history and resist the hype. Click here for a detailed account of early New York City colonial history and more reminders of the fact that Sovereign Original Land Owners were there every step of the way. Details: White/Black. 100% ring spun cotton. Ultra soft. Printed in the USA. Standard Fit/ Unisex. This item ships from the US.

name: 8-Bit Feather Fantasy Earrings (More Colors)
description: These ultra-cool 8-Bit Feather Fantasy Earrings come to us from the colorful collective The Soft Museum. The earrings are available in various color options. They are 100% handmade using only premium Hama beads - small plastic beads that are fused together upon heating. The feathers measure 3.75", and hang 4.5" in total length from the ear. This item ships from the US.

artists.name: Autumn Dawn Gomez (Comanche / Taos) for The Soft Museum

name: Cante Skuya: Sweet Heart Series II
description: These earrings were made by Sun Rose Iron Shell (Sicangu/Oglala Lakota) for her company, Warrior Status. They are inspired by traditional Northern Plains parfleche and are handpainted using acrylic paint on commercial cow rawhide. They feature an "I love you" and a "Bio Hazard" stamp. Silver hooks dangle from the edge of the hearts and accent the earrings. The earrings measure 4" x 3" including hooks. This item ships from the US.

artists.name: Sun Rose Iron Shell (Sicangu / Oglala Lakota)

name: Growing Towards the Light Earrings
description:
These earrings were selected by Presence 4.0 style blogger and scholar Jaclyn Roessel as an item to feature in our new P4xBBB collaboration project. Click here to read more and to see how Jaclyn styles these earrings with a dress, bandana, and her moccasins.
These beautiful earrings come from the creative hands of MaRia A. Bird (Navajo/Hopi/Santa Clara Pueblo), the owner of Mea B'Fly Designs, and are inspired by floral appliqué on plaid material. The design is displayed on front and back. Each graphic print is made by Mea, starting with a focal background photograph that she elaborates with other design elements. The graphic prints are then adhered to a balsa wood piece and topped off with surgical steel earring hooks and jump rings. They are bright with vivid color patterns, lightweight for a comfortable wear, and glossy with a slick overcoat to protect the design. Mea B'Fly earrings are a great fusion of the powerful past with the energy of today. This item ships from the US.

artists.name: MaRia Bird (Navajo / Hopi / Santa Clara Pueblo)

name: Pink Trade Cloth Tote Purse
description: This tote purse was designed by Navajo artist JT Willie. It features a beaded design with dentallium shells and sterling silver handmade conchos on pink eight band broad cloth. It has a calico cotton liner and a leather base with shoulder strap and measures 16" x 13" x 3.5." This item ships from the US. Originally from Twin Lakes, New Mexico, Willie started beading as a teenager, learning techniques from his family, beaders, steamstress, and silversmiths. At the age of 16, he learned the style of beadwork from the Kiowa and Comanche Tribes of Oklahoma. He researches different styles of beadwork and incorporates them into his own unique style.

description: Treat yourself or someone special to a gift set from Beyond Buckskin, featuring our popular 8-Bit Feather Fantasy Earrings by The Soft Museum, Diné Bizaad (Navajo Language) Bandana by David Sloan, and our Lookbook, all wrapped up in a cute black BBB mini-tote. $55 value. name: Diné Bizaad Bandana - Pinks
description:
These cool silkscreened bandanas feature an intricate and original design by Navajo artist David Sloan. Images are paired with their name in the Navajo language - so you can learn the Navajo words for things like bicycle, butterfly, helicopter, and penguin. 

Sloan states, "I hope my art conveys a sense of pride in learning Navajo or any new language and culture. I hope it encourages other people to learn some non-mainstream language also. I hope it conveys an importance to take care of the planet, environment, and our fellow creatures. I feel fortunate to use my imagination to create art."

The bandanas are 100% cotton and measure 20" x 20". Wear as a bandana on your head, neck, arm, or leg, or frame it and hang on your wall as fresh Native street art. This item ships from the US.

name: Small Diamond Shaped Cedar Earrings
description: These earrings were made by Haida/Kwakwakw’wakw artist Nalaga O'Brien. They feature red cedar bark handwoven into diamond shaped earrings with copper hooks. They measure 1.25" x 1.25". name: Butterfly Heart Children's Tee
description: This children's tee was designed by Jamie Gentry (Kwakwaka'wakw), a mother of three boys and the brains behind the environmentally-conscious children's clothing company, Love In Everything. This item ships from the US. The tee has been hand silkscreened with an original Kwagiutl design of a butterfly in a heart, and is a perfect way to signify your love for the special little one in your life. The butterfly is a symbol for a sign of change, art of transformation, dance of joy, desire to travel, clarity, communication, uniting and humor. The tee is made in Canada and is a natural colour made from 70% bamboo and 30% organic cotton. It is silky smooth and cozy against sensitive skin and is perfect for a boy or girl. Each shirt is silkscreened by hand by Gentry, using non toxic, water based inks.
